comment: definition of HP:0000202 (Oral cleft)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: The presence of a cleft in the oral cavity, the two main types of which are cleft lip and cleft palate. In cleft lip, there is the congenital failure of the maxillary and median nasal processes to fuse, forming a groove or fissure in the lip. In cleft palate, there is a congenital failure of the palate to fuse properly, forming a grooved depression or fissure in the roof of the mouth. Clefts of the lip and palate can occur individually or together. It is preferable to code each defect separately
translation_value: La présence d'une fente dans la cavité buccale, dont les deux principaux types sont la fente labiale et la fente palatine. Dans le cas d'une fente labiale, il y a un défaut congénital de fusion entre les processus maxillaire et nasal médian, ce qui forme un sillon ou une fissure dans la lèvre. Dans le cas de la fente palatine, il y a un défaut congénital de fusion du palais, ce qui forme une dépression ou une fissure dans le palais. Les fentes labiales et palatines peuvent se produire individuellement ou ensemble. Il est préférable de coder chaque défaut séparément

comment: label of HP:0000202 (Oral cleft)  ; abnormality of head or neck
translation_value: Fente labio-palatine

comment: definition of HP:0000204 (Cleft upper lip)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: A gap in the upper lip. This is a congenital defect resulting from nonfusion of tissues of the lip during embryonal development
translation_value: Une fente de la lèvre supérieure. Il s'agit d'un défaut congénital résultant de la non fusion des tissus de la lèvre pendant le développement embryonnaire.

translation_value: Circonférence occipito-frontale (tête) inférieure à -3 écarts-types par rapport aux normes normales appropriées, appariées selon l'âge (Ross JJ,1977.PMID:9683597). Alternativement, une diminution de la taille du crâne.

comment: definition of HP:0000376 (Incomplete partition of the cochlea type II)  ; abnormality of the ear
source_value: IWith incomplete partition II, the cochlea consists of 1.5 turns; the apical and middle cochlea turns are undifferentiated and form a cystic apex. The vestibule is normal while the vestibular aqueduct is always enlarged. Developmental arrest occurs at the seventh week of gestation
translation_value: Dans le cas d'une partition II incomplète, la cochlée est constituée de 1,5 tour ; les tours apicaux et médians de la cochlée sont indifférenciés et forment un apex kystique. Le vestibule est normal tandis que l'aqueduc vestibulaire est toujours élargi. L'arrêt du développement se produit à la septième semaine de gestation.

source_value: Absence or abnormal closure of the choana (the posterior nasal aperture)
translation_value: Absence ou fermeture anormale des choanes (l'ouverture nasale postérieure)

comment: definition of HP:0000474 (Thickened nuchal skin fold)  ; abnormality of head or neck ; abnormality of prenatal development or birth
source_value: A thickening of the skin thickness in the posterior aspect of the fetal neck. A nuchal fold measurement is obtained in a transverse section of the fetal head at the level of the cavum septum pellucidum and thalami, angled posteriorly to include the cerebellum. The measurement is taken from the outer edge of the occiput bone to the outer skin limit directly in the midline. A measurement 6 mm or more is considered significant between 18 and 24 weeks and a measurement of 5 mm or more is considered significant at 16 to 18 weeks (pmid:16100637)
translation_value: Un épaississement de l'épaisseur de la peau dans la partie postérieure du cou du fœtus. La mesure du pli nucal est obtenue sur une coupe transversale de la tête du fœtus au niveau du septum pellucidum et des thalami, inclinée vers l'arrière pour inclure le cervelet. La mesure est prise du bord externe de l'os occipital à la limite externe de la peau, directement sur la ligne médiane. Une mesure de 6 mm ou plus est considérée comme significative entre 18 et 24 semaines et une mesure de 5 mm ou plus est considérée comme significative entre 16 et 18 semaines (pmid:16100637).

translation_value: Un type d'astigmatisme associé à des courbures anormales sur la surface antérieure et/ou postérieure de la cornée.

comment: definition of HP:0000543 (Optic disc pallor)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: A pale yellow discoloration of the optic disk (the area of the optic nerve head in the retina). The optic disc normally has a pinkish hue with a central yellowish depression
translation_value: Une coloration jaune pâle du disque optique (zone de la tête du nerf optique dans la rétine). Le disque optique a normalement une teinte rosée avec une dépression centrale jaunâtre.

translation_value: Vision des couleurs anormale

comment: definition of HP:0000572 (Visual loss)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Loss of visual acuity (implying that vision was better at a certain timepoint in life). Otherwise the term reduced visual acuity should be used (or a subclass of that)
translation_value: Perte d'acuité visuelle (impliquant que la vision était meilleure à un certain moment de la vie). Dans le cas contraire, il convient d'utiliser le terme "acuité visuelle réduite" (ou une sous-classe de ce terme).

translation_value: Anomalie du nerf optique

comment: label of HP:0000588 (Optic nerve coloboma)  ; abnormality of the eye

comment: definition of HP:0000618 (Blindness)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as visual perception below 3/60 and/or a visual field of no greater than 10 degress in radius around central fixation
translation_value: Blindness is the condition of lacking visual perception defined as visual perception below 3/60 and/or a visual field of no greater than 10 degress in radius around central fixation

source_value: Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears
translation_value: Abnormally decreased lacrimation, that is, reduced ability to produce tears

comment: definition of HP:0000657 (Oculomotor apraxia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex
translation_value: Ocular motor apraxia is a deficiency in voluntary, horizontal, lateral, fast eye movements (saccades) with retention of slow pursuit movements. The inability to follow objects visually is often compensated by head movements. There may be decreased smooth pursuit, and cancellation of the vestibulo-ocular reflex

translation_value: A developmental anomaly characterized by a reduced number of teeth, whereby up to 6 teeth are missing

translation_value: Increased volume of dental pulp of permanent molar

translation_value: A type of dental dysplasia occurring in dentinogenesis imperfecta in which the pulp chambers are enlarged and there is a reduced amount of coronal dentin

source_value: Erupted tooth or teeth at birth
translation_value: Erupted tooth or teeth at birth

translation_value: The presence of one or more embedded tooth germs which have failed to erupt

comment: label of HP:0000706 (Unerupted tooth)  ; abnormality of head or neck
translation_value: Dent incluse

comment: definition of HP:0000708 (Behavioral abnormality)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities
translation_value: An abnormality of mental functioning including various affective, behavioural, cognitive and perceptual abnormalities

comment: label of HP:0000708 (Behavioral abnormality)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Troubles psychiatriques ou comportementaux

comment: definition of HP:0000709 (Psychosis)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A condition characterized by changes of personality and thought patterns often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs
translation_value: A condition characterized by changes of personality and thought patterns often accompanied by hallucinations and delusional beliefs

comment: definition of HP:0000710 (Hyperorality)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A tendency or compulsion to examine objects by mouth
translation_value: A tendency or compulsion to examine objects by mouth

comment: definition of HP:0000711 (Restlessness)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A state of unease characterized by diffuse motor activity or motion subject to limited control, nonproductive or disorganized behavior, and subjective distress
translation_value: A state of unease characterized by diffuse motor activity or motion subject to limited control, nonproductive or disorganized behavior, and subjective distress

comment: definition of HP:0000712 (Emotional lability)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Unstable emotional experiences and frequent mood changes; emotions that are easily aroused, intense, and/or out of proportion to events and circumstances
translation_value: Unstable emotional experiences and frequent mood changes; emotions that are easily aroused, intense, and/or out of proportion to events and circumstances

comment: definition of HP:0000713 (Agitation)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A state of exceeding restlessness and excessive motor activity associated with mental distress or a feeling of inner tension
translation_value: A state of exceeding restlessness and excessive motor activity associated with mental distress or a feeling of inner tension

comment: definition of HP:0000716 (Depressivity)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Frequent feelings of being down, miserable, and/or hopeless; difficulty recovering from such moods; pessimism about the future; pervasive shame; feeling of inferior self-worth; thoughts of suicide and suicidal behavior
translation_value: Frequent feelings of being down, miserable, and/or hopeless; difficulty recovering from such moods; pessimism about the future; pervasive shame; feeling of inferior self-worth; thoughts of suicide and suicidal behavior

comment: label of HP:0000716 (Depressivity)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Dépression

comment: definition of HP:0000718 (Aggressive behavior)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Aggressive behavior can denote verbal aggression, physical aggression against objects, physical aggression against people, and may also include aggression towards oneself
translation_value: Aggressive behavior can denote verbal aggression, physical aggression against objects, physical aggression against people, and may also include aggression towards oneself

comment: label of HP:0000720 (Mood swings)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Instabilite emotionnelle

comment: definition of HP:0000722 (Obsessive-compulsive behavior)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV)
translation_value: Recurrent obsessions or compulsions that are severe enough to be time consuming (i.e., they take more than 1 hour a day) or cause marked distress or significant impairment (DSM-IV)

comment: label of HP:0000722 (Obsessive-compulsive behavior)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Trouble obsessionnel compulsif

comment: definition of HP:0000723 (Restrictive behavior)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities
translation_value: Behavior characterized by an abnormal limitation to few interests and activities

comment: label of HP:0000728 (Impaired ability to form peer relationships)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Impaired ability to form peer relationships
translation_value: Altération de la capacité à nouer des relations avec ses pairs

comment: label of HP:0000732 (Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Inflexible adherence to routines or rituals
translation_value: Adhérence inflexible aux routines et aux rituels

comment: definition of HP:0000733 (Stereotypy)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A stereotypy is a repetitive, simple movement that can be voluntarily suppressed. Stereotypies are typically simple back-and-forth movements such as waving of flapping the hands or arms, and they do not involve complex sequences or movement fragments. Movement is often but not always rhythmic and may involve fingers, wrists, or more proximal portions of the upper extremity. The lower extremity is not typically involved. Stereotypies are more commonly bilateral than unilateral
translation_value: A stereotypy is a repetitive, simple movement that can be voluntarily suppressed. Stereotypies are typically simple back-and-forth movements such as waving of flapping the hands or arms, and they do not involve complex sequences or movement fragments. Movement is often but not always rhythmic and may involve fingers, wrists, or more proximal portions of the upper extremity. The lower extremity is not typically involved. Stereotypies are more commonly bilateral than unilateral

comment: label of HP:0000733 (Stereotypy)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Stéréotypie

comment: label of HP:0000733 (Stereotypy)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Stéréotypie

comment: definition of HP:0000734 (Disinhibition)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A lack of restraint manifested in several ways, including disregard for social conventions, impulsivity, and poor risk assessment
translation_value: A lack of restraint manifested in several ways, including disregard for social conventions, impulsivity, and poor risk assessment

comment: label of HP:0000735 (Impaired social interactions)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Perturbation des interactions sociales

comment: definition of HP:0000736 (Short attention span)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity but not necessarily satisfying the diagnostic criteria for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
translation_value: Reduced attention span characterized by distractibility and impulsivity but not necessarily satisfying the diagnostic criteria for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder

comment: definition of HP:0000738 (Hallucinations)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Perceptions in a conscious and awake state in the absence of external stimuli which have qualities of real perception, in that they are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space
translation_value: Perceptions in a conscious and awake state in the absence of external stimuli which have qualities of real perception, in that they are vivid, substantial, and located in external objective space

comment: definition of HP:0000739 (Anxiety)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Intense feelings of nervousness, tenseness, or panic, often in reaction to interpersonal stresses; worry about the negative effects of past unpleasant experiences and future negative possibilities; feeling fearful, apprehensive, or threatened by uncertainty; fears of falling apart or losing control
translation_value: Intense feelings of nervousness, tenseness, or panic, often in reaction to interpersonal stresses; worry about the negative effects of past unpleasant experiences and future negative possibilities; feeling fearful, apprehensive, or threatened by uncertainty; fears of falling apart or losing control

comment: definition of HP:0000740 (Episodic paroxysmal anxiety)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Recurrent attacks of severe anxiety, whose occurence is not restricted to any particular situation or set of circumstances and is therefore unpredictable
translation_value: Recurrent attacks of severe anxiety, whose occurence is not restricted to any particular situation or set of circumstances and is therefore unpredictable

comment: definition of HP:0000744 (Low frustration tolerance)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: The feeling of frustration can be defined as an emotional reaction that occurs if a desired goal is not achieved. Frustration intolerance is defined as an age-inappropriate response to frustration characterized by crying or temper tantrums (in children) or aggressive or other undesirable behaviors
translation_value: The feeling of frustration can be defined as an emotional reaction that occurs if a desired goal is not achieved. Frustration intolerance is defined as an age-inappropriate response to frustration characterized by crying or temper tantrums (in children) or aggressive or other undesirable behaviors

comment: definition of HP:0000745 (Diminished motivation)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A reduction in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action
translation_value: A reduction in goal-directed behavior, that is, motivation, the determinant of behavior and adaptation that allows individuals to get started, be energized to perform a sustained and directed action

comment: label of HP:0000745 (Diminished motivation)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Baisse de motivation

comment: definition of HP:0000746 (Delusions)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A belief that is pathological and is held despite evidence to the contrary
translation_value: A belief that is pathological and is held despite evidence to the contrary

comment: label of HP:0000746 (Delusions)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Délires

comment: definition of HP:0000962 (Hyperkeratosis)  ; abnormality of the integument

comment: definition of HP:0000964 (Eczema)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the immune system
source_value: Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding
translation_value: Eczema is a form of dermatitis. The term eczema is broadly applied to a range of persistent skin conditions and can be related to a number of underlying conditions. Manifestations of eczema can include dryness and recurring skin rashes with redness, skin edema, itching and dryness, crusting, flaking, blistering, cracking, oozing, or bleeding

comment: definition of HP:0000965 (Cutis marmorata)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata, also called livedo reticularis, generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather
translation_value: A reticular discoloration of the skin with cyanotic (reddish-blue appearing) areas surrounding pale central areas due to dilation of capillary blood vessels and stagnation of blood within the vessels. Cutis marmorata, also called livedo reticularis, generally occurs on the legs, arms and trunk and is often more severe in cold weather

comment: definition of HP:0001249 (Intellectual disability)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Subnormal intellectual functioning which originates during the developmental period. Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, has been defined as an IQ score below 70
translation_value: Subnormal intellectual functioning which originates during the developmental period. Intellectual disability, previously referred to as mental retardation, has been defined as an IQ score below 70

comment: definition of HP:0001250 (Seizures)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Seizures are an intermittent abnormality of the central nervous system due to a sudden, excessive, disorderly discharge of cerebral neurons and characterized clinically by some combination of disturbance of sensation, loss of consciousness, impairment of psychic function, or convulsive movements. The term epilepsy is used to describe chronic, recurrent seizures
translation_value: Seizures are an intermittent abnormality of the central nervous system due to a sudden, excessive, disorderly discharge of cerebral neurons and characterized clinically by some combination of disturbance of sensation, loss of consciousness, impairment of psychic function, or convulsive movements. The term epilepsy is used to describe chronic, recurrent seizures

comment: definition of HP:0001251 (Ataxia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- oder overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly)
translation_value: Cerebellar ataxia refers to ataxia due to dysfunction of the cerebellum. This causes a variety of elementary neurological deficits including asynergy (lack of coordination between muscles, limbs and joints), dysmetria (lack of ability to judge distances that can lead to under- oder overshoot in grasping movements), and dysdiadochokinesia (inability to perform rapid movements requiring antagonizing muscle groups to be switched on and off repeatedly)

comment: definition of HP:0001252 (Muscular hypotonia)  ; abnormality of the musculature
source_value: Muscular hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle), often involving reduced muscle strength. Hypotonia is characterized by a diminished resistance to passive stretching
translation_value: Muscular hypotonia is an abnormally low muscle tone (the amount of tension or resistance to movement in a muscle), often involving reduced muscle strength. Hypotonia is characterized by a diminished resistance to passive stretching

comment: label of HP:0001252 (Muscular hypotonia)  ; abnormality of the musculature
translation_value: Hypotonie musculaire

comment: definition of HP:0001254 (Lethargy)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A state of disinterestedness, listlessness, and indifference, resulting in difficulty performing simple tasks or concentrating
translation_value: A state of disinterestedness, listlessness, and indifference, resulting in difficulty performing simple tasks or concentrating

comment: definition of HP:0001256 (Intellectual disability, mild)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Mild intellectual disability is defined as an intelligence quotient (IQ) in the range of 50-69

translation_value: Déficience intellectuelle légère

source_value: Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles
translation_value: Spasticity and weakness of the leg and hip muscles

comment: definition of HP:0001259 (Coma)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Complete absence of wakefulness and content of conscience, which manifests itself as a lack of response to any kind of external stimuli
translation_value: Complete absence of wakefulness and content of conscience, which manifests itself as a lack of response to any kind of external stimuli

comment: definition of HP:0001272 (Cerebellar atrophy)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Atrophy (wasting) of the cerebellum

comment: definition of HP:0001279 (Syncope)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Syncope refers to a generalized weakness of muscles with loss of postural tone, inability to stand upright, and loss of consciousness. Once the patient is in a horizontal position, blood flow to the brain is no longer hindered by gravitation and consciousness is regained. Unconsciousness usually lasts for seconds to minutes. Headache and drowsiness (which usually follow seizures) do not follow a syncopal attack. Syncope results from a sudden impairment of brain metabolism usually due to a reduction in cerebral blood flow
translation_value: Syncope refers to a generalized weakness of muscles with loss of postural tone, inability to stand upright, and loss of consciousness. Once the patient is in a horizontal position, blood flow to the brain is no longer hindered by gravitation and consciousness is regained. Unconsciousness usually lasts for seconds to minutes. Headache and drowsiness (which usually follow seizures) do not follow a syncopal attack. Syncope results from a sudden impairment of brain metabolism usually due to a reduction in cerebral blood flow

comment: definition of HP:0001281 (Tetany)  ; abnormality of the musculature
source_value: A condition characterized by intermittent involuntary contraction of muscles (spasms) related to hypocalcemia or occasionally magneisum deficiency
translation_value: A condition characterized by intermittent involuntary contraction of muscles (spasms) related to hypocalcemia or occasionally magneisum deficiency

comment: definition of HP:0001288 (Gait disturbance)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk. In general, this can refer to neurological diseases but also fractures or other sources of pain that is triggered upon walking. However, in the current context gait disturbance refers to difficulty walking on the basis of a neurological or muscular disease
translation_value: The term gait disturbance can refer to any disruption of the ability to walk. In general, this can refer to neurological diseases but also fractures or other sources of pain that is triggered upon walking. However, in the current context gait disturbance refers to difficulty walking on the basis of a neurological or muscular disease

comment: definition of HP:0001300 (Parkinsonism)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting form degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait
translation_value: Characteristic neurologic anomaly resulting form degeneration of dopamine-generating cells in the substantia nigra, a region of the midbrain, characterized clinically by shaking, rigidity, slowness of movement and difficulty with walking and gait

comment: definition of HP:0001302 (Pachygyria)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere chacterized by unusually thick gyrations (convolutions) of the cerebral cortex
translation_value: A congenital abnormality of the cerebral hemisphere chacterized by unusually thick gyrations (convolutions) of the cerebral cortex

comment: definition of HP:0001321 (Cerebellar hypoplasia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Underdevelopment of the cerebellum

translation_value: Très petit cerveau

comment: label of HP:0001327 (Photomyoclonic seizures)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Convulsions photomyocloniques

comment: definition of HP:0001335 (Bimanual synkinesia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

comment: definition of HP:0001339 (Lissencephaly)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Lissencephaly (LIS, which subsumes the terms agyria and pachygyria), together with subcortical-band heterotopia (SBH) comprises a spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration. The key features of LIS are an abnormally thick cortex with reduced or absent formation of the cerebral convolutions, while SBH consists of abnormal bands of neurons beneath a normal cortex, although the cerebral gyri may be separated by unusually shallow sulci
translation_value: Lissencephaly (LIS, which subsumes the terms agyria and pachygyria), together with subcortical-band heterotopia (SBH) comprises a spectrum of malformations of cortical development caused by insufficient neuronal migration. The key features of LIS are an abnormally thick cortex with reduced or absent formation of the cerebral convolutions, while SBH consists of abnormal bands of neurons beneath a normal cortex, although the cerebral gyri may be separated by unusually shallow sulci

comment: definition of HP:0001348 (Brisk reflexes)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Tendon reflexes that are noticably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examnation). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal
translation_value: Tendon reflexes that are noticably more active than usual (conventionally denoted 3+ on clinical examnation). Brisk reflexes may or may not indicate a neurological lesion. They are distinguished from hyperreflexia by the fact that hyerreflexia is characterized by hyperactive repeating (clonic) reflexes, which are considered to be always abnormal

comment: definition of HP:0002373 (Febrile seizures)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Febrile seizures are convulsions induced by a fever in infants or small children and are generally characterized by loss of consciousness and tonic-clonic movements. Most febrile seizures last a minute or two

comment: definition of HP:0002384 (Focal impaired awareness seizure)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A type of focal-onset saeizure characterized by impaired awareness. Awareness during a seizure is defined as the patient being fully aware of themself and their environment throughout the seizure, even if immobile. If awareness is impaired at any point during the seizure, the seizure is a focal impaired awareness seizure. The degree of loss of awareness may vary
translation_value: A type of focal-onset saeizure characterized by impaired awareness. Awareness during a seizure is defined as the patient being fully aware of themself and their environment throughout the seizure, even if immobile. If awareness is impaired at any point during the seizure, the seizure is a focal impaired awareness seizure. The degree of loss of awareness may vary

comment: definition of HP:0002415 (Leukodystrophy)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes
translation_value: Leukodystrophy refers to deterioration of white matter of the brain resulting from degeneration of myelin sheaths in the CNS. Their basic defect is directly related to the synthesis and maintenance of myelin membranes

comment: definition of HP:0002476 (Primitive reflex)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: The primitive reflexes are a group of behavioural motor responses which are found in normal early development, are subsequently inhibited, but may be released from inhibition by cerebral, usually frontal, damage. They are thus part of a broader group of reflexes which reflect release phenomena, such as exaggerated stretch reflexes and extensor plantars. They do however involve more complex motor responses than such simple stretch reflexes, and are often a normal feature in the neonate or infant
translation_value: The primitive reflexes are a group of behavioural motor responses which are found in normal early development, are subsequently inhibited, but may be released from inhibition by cerebral, usually frontal, damage. They are thus part of a broader group of reflexes which reflect release phenomena, such as exaggerated stretch reflexes and extensor plantars. They do however involve more complex motor responses than such simple stretch reflexes, and are often a normal feature in the neonate or infant

comment: definition of HP:0002493 (Upper motor neuron dysfunction)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A functional anomaly of the upper motor neuron. The upper motor neurons are neurons of the primary motor cortex which project to the brainstem and spinal chord via the corticonuclear, corticobulbar and corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts. They are involved in control of voluntary movements.nDysfunction leads to weakness, impairment of fine motor movements, spasticity, hyperreflexia and abnormal pyramidal signs
translation_value: A functional anomaly of the upper motor neuron. The upper motor neurons are neurons of the primary motor cortex which project to the brainstem and spinal chord via the corticonuclear, corticobulbar and corticospinal (pyramidal) tracts. They are involved in control of voluntary movements.nDysfunction leads to weakness, impairment of fine motor movements, spasticity, hyperreflexia and abnormal pyramidal signs

comment: definition of HP:0002494 (Abnormal rapid eye movement sleep)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Abnormality of REM sleep. Phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tonus except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are then phases of rapid eye movements
translation_value: Abnormality of REM sleep. Phases of REM sleep are characterized by desynchronized EEG patterns, increases in heart rate and blood pressure, sympathetic activation, and a profound loss of muscle tonus except for the eye and middle-ear muscles. There are then phases of rapid eye movements

comment: definition of HP:0002608 (Celiac disease)  ; abnormality of the digestive system ; abnormality of the immune system
source_value: Celiac disease (CD) is an autoimmune condition affecting the small intestine, triggered by the ingestion of gluten, the protein fraction of wheat, barley, and rye. Clinical manifestations of CD are highly variable and include both gastrointestinal and non-gastrointestinal features. The hallmark of CD is an immune-mediated enteropathy. This term is included because the occurence of CD is seen as a feature of a number of other diseases
translation_value: Celiac disease (CD) is an autoimmune condition affecting the small intestine, triggered by the ingestion of gluten, the protein fraction of wheat, barley, and rye. Clinical manifestations of CD are highly variable and include both gastrointestinal and non-gastrointestinal features. The hallmark of CD is an immune-mediated enteropathy. This term is included because the occurence of CD is seen as a feature of a number of other diseases

comment: definition of HP:0002635 (Type IV atherosclerotic lesion)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: In type IV atherosclerotic lesions a dense accumulation of extracellular lipid occupies an extensive but well-defined region of the intima. This type of extracellular lipid accumulation is known as the lipid core. A fibrous tissue increase is not a feature, and complications such as defects of the lesion surface and thrombosis are not present. The type IV lesion is also known as atheroma. Type IV is the first lesion considered advanced in this classification because of the severe intimal disorganization caused by the lipid core. The characteristic core appears to develop from an increase and the consequent confluence of the small isolated pools of extracellular lipid that characterize type III lesions. The increase in lipid is believed to result from continued insudation from the plasma. The nature and derivations of the lipid that constitutes the core are discussed in the section on the extracellular matrix at the end of this report. Type IV lesions, when they first appear in younger people, are found in the same locations as adaptive intimal thickenings of the eccentric type. Thus, atheroma is, at least initially, an eccentric lesion
translation_value: In type IV atherosclerotic lesions a dense accumulation of extracellular lipid occupies an extensive but well-defined region of the intima. This type of extracellular lipid accumulation is known as the lipid core. A fibrous tissue increase is not a feature, and complications such as defects of the lesion surface and thrombosis are not present. The type IV lesion is also known as atheroma. Type IV is the first lesion considered advanced in this classification because of the severe intimal disorganization caused by the lipid core. The characteristic core appears to develop from an increase and the consequent confluence of the small isolated pools of extracellular lipid that characterize type III lesions. The increase in lipid is believed to result from continued insudation from the plasma. The nature and derivations of the lipid that constitutes the core are discussed in the section on the extracellular matrix at the end of this report. Type IV lesions, when they first appear in younger people, are found in the same locations as adaptive intimal thickenings of the eccentric type. Thus, atheroma is, at least initially, an eccentric lesion

comment: definition of HP:0004904 (Maturity-onset diabetes of the young)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
source_value: The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells
translation_value: The term Maturity-onset diabetes of the young (MODY) was initially used for patients diagnosed with fasting hyperglycemia that could be treated without insulin for more than two years, where the initial diagnosis was made at a young age (under 25 years). Thus, MODY combines characteristics of type 1 diabetes (young age at diagnosis) and type 2 diabetes (less insulin dependence than type 1 diabetes). The term MODY is now most often used to refer to a group of monogenic diseases with these characteristics. Here, the term is used to describe hyperglycemia diagnosed at a young age with no or minor insulin dependency, no evidence of insulin resistence, and lack of evidence of autoimmune destruction of the beta cells

comment: definition of HP:0007270 (Atypical absence seizure)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: An atypical absence seizure has less abrupt onset and offset of loss of awareness than typical absence seizures. They are often associated with other features such as loss of muscle tone of the head, trunk or limbs (often a gradual slump) and subtle myoclonic jerks. Atypical absence seizures often occur in individuals with intellectual impairment.The loss of awareness may be minimal with the patient continuing an activity, but more slowly or with mistakes
translation_value: An atypical absence seizure has less abrupt onset and offset of loss of awareness than typical absence seizures. They are often associated with other features such as loss of muscle tone of the head, trunk or limbs (often a gradual slump) and subtle myoclonic jerks. comment: definition of HP:0007634 (Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: An acute condition characterized by sudden visual loss (usually discovered in the morning), optic disc edema at onset, optic disc-related visual field defects. Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy can be associated with flame hemorrhages on the swollen disc or nearby neuroretinal layer, and sometimes with nearby cotton-wool exudates
translation_value: An acute condition characterized by sudden visual loss (usually discovered in the morning), optic disc edema at onset, optic disc-related visual field defects. Nonarteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy can be associated with flame hemorrhages on the swollen disc or nearby neuroretinal layer, and sometimes with nearby cotton-wool exudates

comment: definition of HP:0007773 (Vitreoretinopathy)  ; abnormality of the eye

translation_value: Ocular abnormality characterised by premature degeneration of the vitreous and the retina that may be associated with increased risk of retinal detachment

comment: definition of HP:0007894 (Hypopigmentation of the fundus)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid)
translation_value: Reduced pigmentation of the fundus, typically generalised. Fundoscopy may reveal a low level pigment in both RPE and choroid with clear visibility of choroidal vessels (pale/albinoid) or low pigment level in the RPE with deep pigment in choroid so that visible choroidal vessels are separated by deeply pigmented zones (tesselated/tigroid)

comment: definition of HP:0007929 (Peripheral retinal detachment)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium occuring near the outer limit (periphery) of the retina
translation_value: Separation of the inner layers of the retina (neural retina) from the pigment epithelium occuring near the outer limit (periphery) of the retina

comment: definition of HP:0007968 (Remnants of the hyaloid vascular system)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract
translation_value: Persistence of the hyaloid artery, which is the embryonic artery that runs from the optic disk to the posterior lens capsule may persist; the site of attachment may form an opacity. The hyaloid artery is a branch of the ophthalmic artery, and usually regresses completely before birth. This features results from a failure of regression of the hyaloid vessel, which supplies the primary vitreous during embryogenesis and normally regresses in the third trimester of pregnancy, leading to a particular form of posterior cataract

comment: definition of HP:0008629 (Pulsatile tinnitus)  ; abnormality of the ear
source_value: Pulsatile tinnitus is generally classified a kind of objective tinnitus, meaning that it is not only audible to the patient but also to the examiner on auscultation of the auditory canal and/or of surrounding structures with use of an auscultation tube or stethoscope. Usually, pulsatile tinnitus is heard as a lower pitched thumping or booming, a rougher blowing sound which is coincidental with respiration, or as a clicking, higher pitched rhythmic sensation. Pulsatile tinnitus may be associated with vascular abnormalities such as arterioevenous shunts or glomus tumors or the jugular vein, arterial bruits related to a high-riding carotid artery (close to the auditory areas) or carotid stenosis, or venous abnormalities such as a dehiscent jugular bulb or to hypertension. Finally, in some patients, mechanical abnormalities such a spatulous eustachian tubes, palatomyoclonus (small spasms of muscles in the soft palate area), or idiopathic stapedial muscle spasm may represent the underlying cause of pulsatile tinnitus
translation_value: Pulsatile tinnitus is generally classified a kind of objective tinnitus, meaning that it is not only audible to the patient but also to the examiner on auscultation of the auditory canal and/or of surrounding structures with use of an auscultation tube or stethoscope. Usually, pulsatile tinnitus is heard as a lower pitched thumping or booming, a rougher blowing sound which is coincidental with respiration, or as a clicking, higher pitched rhythmic sensation. Pulsatile tinnitus may be associated with vascular abnormalities such as arterioevenous shunts or glomus tumors or the jugular vein, arterial bruits related to a high-riding carotid artery (close to the auditory areas) or carotid stenosis, or venous abnormalities such as a dehiscent jugular bulb or to hypertension. Finally, in some patients, mechanical abnormalities such a spatulous eustachian tubes, palatomyoclonus (small spasms of muscles in the soft palate area), or idiopathic stapedial muscle spasm may represent the underlying cause of pulsatile tinnitus

comment: definition of HP:0009666 (Cone-shaped epiphysis of the proximal phalanx of the thumb)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits
translation_value: A cone-shaped appearance of the epiphysis of the middle phalanx of the thumb of the hand, producing a 'ball-in-a-socket' appearance. This epiphysis is located at the proximal end of the phalanx and is normally nearly flat. The related entity 'angel-shaped' epiphysis refers to a pronounced cone-shaped epiphysis in combination with a pseudoepiphysis at the distal end of the phalanx. In contrast to the proximal phalanges of the digits 2-5, the proximal phalanx of the thumb is embryologically equivalent to the middle phalanges of the other digits, whereas the first metacarpal is embryologically of phalangeal origin and as such equivalent to the proximal phalanges of the other digits

comment: definition of HP:0009943 (Complete duplication of thumb phalanx)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: A complete duplication affecting one or more of the phalanges of the thumb. As opposed to a partial duplication were there is still a variable degree of fusion between the duplicated bones, a complete duplication leads to two separate bones appearing side to side (radio-ulnar axis) as seen on x-rays. A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also refered to as Hyperphalangism

A duplication leading to an accesory bone appearing in the proximo-distal axis on x-rays, this is actually a different entity called a Pseudoepiphyses (see according terms) sometimes also refered to as Hyperphalangism

comment: definition of HP:0010440 (Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes refered to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200)
translation_value: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the fibular side of the foot, next top the little toe), preaxial (on the tibial side of the foot, next to the big toe) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between big and little toe), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes refered to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200)

comment: label of HP:0010440 (Ectopic accesory toe-like appendage)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
translation_value: Appendice accesoire ectopique ressemblant à un orteil

comment: definition of HP:0010441 (Ectopic accessory finger-like appendage)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the ulnar side of the hand, next to the little finger), preaxial (on the radial side of the hand, next to the thumb) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between thumb and little finger), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes refered to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200)
translation_value: In contrast to forms of polydactyly where the supernumerary digit (this can either be a rudimentary or a completely 'normal' digit) is either located postaxial (on the ulnar side of the hand, next to the little finger), preaxial (on the radial side of the hand, next to the thumb) or mesoaxial (somewhere central, between thumb and little finger), a supernumerary digit may also be placed ectopically, meaning anywhere else except post-,meso- or preaxial. In the literature this is sometimes refered to as Disorganisation-like Syndrome (OMIM223200)

comment: definition of HP:0010492 (Osseous finger syndactyly)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism"
translation_value: Webbing or fusion of the fingers, involving soft parts and including fusion of individual finger bones. Bony fusions are referred to as "bony" Syndactyly if the fusion occurs in a radio-ulnar axis. Fusions of bones of the fingers in a proximo-distal axis are referred to as "Symphalangism"

comment: definition of HP:0010524 (Agnosia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Inability to recognize objects not because of sensory deficit but because of the inability to combine components of sensory impressions into a complete pattern. Thus, agnosia is a neurological condition which results in an inability to know, to name, to identify, and to extract meaning from visual, auditory, or tactile impressions
translation_value: Inability to recognize objects not because of sensory deficit but because of the inability to combine components of sensory impressions into a complete pattern. Thus, agnosia is a neurological condition which results in an inability to know, to name, to identify, and to extract meaning from visual, auditory, or tactile impressions

comment: definition of HP:0010527 (Astereognosia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Inability to recognize the form of objects by touch without visual input. That is, an impairment in the recognition of objects based only on the texture, size, weight and three-dimensional form of the object in the absence of any major somatosensory deficit
translation_value: Inability to recognize the form of objects by touch without visual input. That is, an impairment in the recognition of objects based only on the texture, size, weight and three-dimensional form of the object in the absence of any major somatosensory deficit

comment: definition of HP:0010535 (Sleep apnea)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; abnormality of the respiratory system
source_value: An intermittent cessation of airflow at the mouth and nose during sleep. Apneas of at least 10 seconds are considered important, but persons with sleep apnea may have apneas of 20 seconds to up to 2 or 3 minutes. Patients may have up to 15 events per hour of sleep
translation_value: An intermittent cessation of airflow at the mouth and nose during sleep. Apneas of at least 10 seconds are considered important, but persons with sleep apnea may have apneas of 20 seconds to up to 2 or 3 minutes. Patients may have up to 15 events per hour of sleep

comment: definition of HP:0010536 (Central sleep apnea)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; abnormality of the respiratory system
source_value: Sleep apnea resulting from a transient abolition of the central drive to the ventilatory muscles
translation_value: Sleep apnea resulting from a transient abolition of the central drive to the ventilatory muscles

comment: definition of HP:0010546 (Muscle fibrillation)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Fine, rapid twitching of individual muscle fibers with little or no movement of the muscle as a whole. If a motor neuron or its axon is destroyed, the muscle fibers it innervates undergo denervation atrophy. This leads to hypersensitivity of individual muscle fibers to acetyl choline so that they may contract spontaneously. Isolated activity of individual muscle fibers is generally so fine it cannot be seen through the intact skin, although it can be recorded as a short-duration spike in the EMG
translation_value: Fine, rapid twitching of individual muscle fibers with little or no movement of the muscle as a whole. If a motor neuron or its axon is destroyed, the muscle fibers it innervates undergo denervation atrophy. This leads to hypersensitivity of individual muscle fibers to acetyl choline so that they may contract spontaneously. Isolated activity of individual muscle fibers is generally so fine it cannot be seen through the intact skin, although it can be recorded as a short-duration spike in the EMG

comment: definition of HP:0010689 (Mirror image polydactyly)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: A hand or foot with more than five digits that has a recognizable A/P axis of symmetry. The axis can lie within a normally formed or partially duplicated digit resembling a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe, or hallux. Alternatively, the axis can be in an interdigital space with a flanking pair of digits that resemble a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe or hallux. The most lateral digits on each side of the hand typically resemble fifth fingers/toes
translation_value: A hand or foot with more than five digits that has a recognizable A/P axis of symmetry. The axis can lie within a normally formed or partially duplicated digit resembling a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe, or hallux. Alternatively, the axis can be in an interdigital space with a flanking pair of digits that resemble a middle finger, index finger, thumb, toe or hallux. The most lateral digits on each side of the hand typically resemble fifth fingers/toes

comment: definition of HP:0010822 (Scintillating scotoma)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: A scintillating scotoma is a common visual aura that can preced a migraine, whereby a spot of flickering light near the center of the visual fields occurs. The spot prevents vision, and is thus termed scotoma. The scotoma can extend into one or more shimmering arcs of white or colored flashing lights
translation_value: A scintillating scotoma is a common visual aura that can preced a migraine, whereby a spot of flickering light near the center of the visual fields occurs. The spot prevents vision, and is thus termed scotoma. The scotoma can extend into one or more shimmering arcs of white or colored flashing lights

source_value: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) can be diagnosed prenatally if ultrasound shows a cystic or solid lung tumor. A CCAM does not have systemic arterial blood supply (in contrast to bronchopulmonary sequenstration). It is a cystic area within the lung that originates from abnormal embryogenesis
translation_value: Congenital cystic adenomatoid malformation (CCAM) can be diagnosed prenatally if ultrasound shows a cystic or solid lung tumor. comment: definition of HP:0011147 (Typical absence seizure)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A typical absence seizure is a generalized seizure with abrupt onset and offset of altered awareness which can vary in severity (see specific syndromes). Memory for events during the seizures is usually impaired although there may be some retained awareness particularly for adolescents. Clonic movements of eyelids, head, eyebrows, chin, perioral or other facial parts may occur, most typically at 3Hz. Myoclonus of limbs can rarely occur. Oral and manual automatisms are common and there may be perseveration of behaviors occurring prior to seizure onset
translation_value: A typical absence seizure is a generalized seizure with abrupt onset and offset of altered awareness which can vary in severity (see specific syndromes). Memory for events during the seizures is usually impaired although there may be some retained awareness particularly for adolescents. Clonic movements of eyelids, head, eyebrows, chin, perioral or other facial parts may occur, most typically at 3Hz. Myoclonus of limbs can rarely occur. Oral and manual automatisms are common and there may be perseveration of behaviors occurring prior to seizure onset

comment: definition of HP:0011149 (Absence seizure with eyelid myoclonia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Absence seizures accompanied by brief, repetitive, often rhythmic, fast (4-6 Hz) myoclonic jerks of the eyelids with simultaneous upward deviation of the eyeballs and extension of the head. Seizures are typically very brief (less than 6s in duration) and multiple seizures occur on a daily basis. Mostly awareness is retained
translation_value: Absence seizures accompanied by brief, repetitive, often rhythmic, fast (4-6 Hz) myoclonic jerks of the eyelids with simultaneous upward deviation of the eyeballs and extension of the head. Seizures are typically very brief (less than 6s in duration) and multiple seizures occur on a daily basis. Mostly awareness is retained

comment: definition of HP:0011150 (Myoclonic absence)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Rhythmic myoclonic jerks of the shoulders and arms with tonic abduction that results in progressive lifting of the arms during the seizure. The myoclonic jerks are typically bilateral but may be unilateral or asymmetric. Perioral myoclonias and rhythmic jerks of the head and legs may occur. Seizures last 10-60 seconds and typically occur daily. Level of awareness varies from complete loss of awareness to retained awareness
translation_value: Rhythmic myoclonic jerks of the shoulders and arms with tonic abduction that results in progressive lifting of the arms during the seizure. The myoclonic jerks are typically bilateral but may be unilateral or asymmetric. Perioral myoclonias and rhythmic jerks of the head and legs may occur. Seizures last 10-60 seconds and typically occur daily. Level of awareness varies from complete loss of awareness to retained awareness

comment: label of HP:0011150 (Myoclonic absence)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Absences myocloniques

translation_value: Focal seizures with an objectively documented and distinct alteration of autonomic nervous system function involving cardiovascular, pupillary, gastrointestinal, sudomotor, vasomotor and thermoregularity functions

source_value: The cisterna magna is measured on a transaxial view of the fetal head angled 15 degrees caudal to the canthomeatal line. comment: definition of HP:0011540 (Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta
translation_value: The essence of the lesion is the combination of discordant atrioventricular and ventriculo-arterial connections. Thus, the morphologically right atrium is connected to a morphologically left ventricle across the mitral valve, with the left ventricle then connected to the pulmonary trunk. The morphologically left atrium is connected to the morphologically right ventricle across the tricuspid valve, with the morphologically right ventricle connected to the aorta

comment: definition of HP:0011627 (Aorto-ventricular tunnel)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Aorto-ventricular tunnel is a congenital, extracardiac channel which connects the ascending aorta above the sinutubular junction to the cavity of the left, or (less commonly) right ventricle
translation_value: Aorto-ventricular tunnel is a congenital, extracardiac channel which connects the ascending aorta above the sinutubular junction to the cavity of the left, or (less commonly) right ventricle

comment: definition of HP:0011643 (Coronary sinus atrial septal defect)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: An atrial septal defect characterized by a deficiency in the tissue separating the coronary sinus from the left atrium (LA). This results in partial or complete unroofing of the coronary sinus leading to a predominantly left-to-right shunt through the coronary sinus (LA to coronary sinus to right atrium [RA]). The orifice of the ostium is frequently large because of the increased flow. From the RA side, the defect is located at the level of the coronary sinus ostium and may also include some deficiency in atrial tissue around the ostium. From the LA side, the size can be variable depending on the degree of unroofing of the coronary sinus
translation_value: An atrial septal defect characterized by a deficiency in the tissue separating the coronary sinus from the left atrium (LA). This results in partial or complete unroofing of the coronary sinus leading to a predominantly left-to-right shunt through the coronary sinus (LA to coronary sinus to right atrium [RA]). The orifice of the ostium is frequently large because of the increased flow. From the RA side, the defect is located at the level of the coronary sinus ostium and may also include some deficiency in atrial tissue around the ostium. From the LA side, the size can be variable depending on the degree of unroofing of the coronary sinus

comment: definition of HP:0011651 (Double outlet right ventricle with doubly committed ventricular septal defect and pulmonary stenosis)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A double outlet right ventricle with a subaortic ventritricular septal defect (a hotel between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that extends anterosuperiorly and arere closely related to the pulmonary artery as well, are considered to be doubly committed. There is associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches
translation_value: A double outlet right ventricle with a subaortic ventritricular septal defect (a hotel between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that extends anterosuperiorly and arere closely related to the pulmonary artery as well, are considered to be doubly committed. There is associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches

comment: definition of HP:0011652 (Double outlet right ventricle with doubly committed ventricular septal defect without pulmonary stenosis)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A double outlet right ventricle with a subaortic ventritricular septal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that extends anterosuperiorly and arere closely related to the pulmonary artery as well, are considered to be doubly committed. There is not associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches
translation_value: A double outlet right ventricle with a subaortic ventritricular septal defect (a hole between the two bottom chambers (ventricles) of the heart), that extends anterosuperiorly and arere closely related to the pulmonary artery as well, are considered to be doubly committed. There is not associated pulmonary stenosis, the abnormal narrowing or constriction of the pulmonary artery, in the main pulmonary artery and/or in the left or right pulmonary artery branches

comment: definition of HP:0011672 (Cardiac myxoma)  ; neoplasm ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A myxoma (tumor of primitive connective tissue) of the heart. Cardiac myxomas consist of stellate to plump, cytologically bland mesenchymal cells set in a myxoid stroma. Cardiac myxomas are of endocardial origina and general project from the endocardium into a cardiac chamber
translation_value: A myxoma (tumor of primitive connective tissue) of the heart. Cardiac myxomas consist of stellate to plump, cytologically bland mesenchymal cells set in a myxoid stroma. Cardiac myxomas are of endocardial origina and general project from the endocardium into a cardiac chamber

comment: definition of HP:0011674 (Cardiac teratoma)  ; abnormality of the genitourinary system ; neoplasm ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A teratoma within the heart. Most commonly, these tumors are detected in the pericardial cavity attached to the pulmonary artery and aorta. The tumour size within the heart varies from 2 to 9 cm in diameter, and intrapericardial tumors as large as 15 cm have been reported. Intracardiac tumors arise from the atrial or ventricular wall as nodular masses protruding into the cardiac chambers. Cardiac and pericardial teratomas are easily detected in the fetus and neonate by two-dimensional echocardiography as heterogeneous and encapsulated cystic masses. Histologically, cardiac teratomas contain multiple immature elements including epithelium, neuroglial tissue, thyroid, pancreas, smooth and skeletal muscle, cartilage and bone
translation_value: A teratoma within the heart. Most commonly, these tumors are detected in the pericardial cavity attached to the pulmonary artery and aorta. The tumour size within the heart varies from 2 to 9 cm in diameter, and intrapericardial tumors as large as 15 cm have been reported. Intracardiac tumors arise from the atrial or ventricular wall as nodular masses protruding into the cardiac chambers. Cardiac and pericardial teratomas are easily detected in the fetus and neonate by two-dimensional echocardiography as heterogeneous and encapsulated cystic masses. Histologically, cardiac teratomas contain multiple immature elements including epithelium, neuroglial tissue, thyroid, pancreas, smooth and skeletal muscle, cartilage and bone

comment: definition of HP:0011904 (Persistence of hemoglobin F)  ; abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
source_value: Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobiin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent
translation_value: Hemoglobin F (HbF) contains two globin alpha chains and two globin gamma chains. It is the main form of hemoglobin in the fetus during the last seven months of intrauterine development and in the half year of postnatal life. In adults it normally makes up less than one percent of all hemoglobiin. This term refers to an increase in HbF above this limit. In beta thalassemia major, it may represent over 90 percent of all hemoglobin, and in beta thalassemia minor it may make up between 0.5 to 4 percent

comment: definition of HP:0011956 (Intestinal lymphoid nodular hyperplasia)  ; abnormality of the digestive system
source_value: A lymphoproliferative abnormality of the intestine characterized by numerous visible mucosal nodules measuring up to, and rarely exceeding, 0.5 cm in diameter Histologically, hyperplastic lymphoid follicles with large germinal centres are seen in the lamina propria and superficial submucosa. There is enlargement of the mucosal B cell follicles caused by hyperplasia of the follicle centres; surrounded by a normal appearing mantle zone. Disease may involve the stomach, the entire small intestine, and the large intestine
translation_value: A lymphoproliferative abnormality of the intestine characterized by numerous visible mucosal nodules measuring up to, and rarely exceeding, 0.5 cm in diameter Histologically, hyperplastic lymphoid follicles with large germinal centres are seen in the lamina propria and superficial submucosa. There is enlargement of the mucosal B cell follicles caused by hyperplasia of the follicle centres; surrounded by a normal appearing mantle zone. Disease may involve the stomach, the entire small intestine, and the large intestine

comment: definition of HP:0012060 (Acral lentiginous melanoma)  ; abnormality of the integument ; neoplasm
source_value: A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed
translation_value: A type of cutaneous melanoma localized to the palm, sole, or beneath the nail (subungual melanoma). Acral lentiginous melanoma starts as a slowly-enlarging flat patch of discoloured skin and usually displays a size above 6 mm and often several centimetres or more in diameter upon diagnosis and variable pigmentation with a mixutre of colors including brown, and blue-grey, black and red. The surface of the lesion is initially smooth but later in the course may become thicker and irregular, and may ulcerate or bleed

source_value: Abnormally increased levels of Methemoglobinemia in the blood. In this form of hemoglobin, there is an oxidized ferric iron (Fe +3) rather than the reduced ferrous form (Fe 2+) that is normally found in hemoglobin. Methemoglobin has a reduced affinity for oxygen, resulting in a reduced ability to release oxygen to tissues

comment: definition of HP:0012663 (Mildly reduced ejection fraction)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system

translation_value: A small reduction in the fraction of blood pumped from the left ventricle with each cardiac cycle. The normal range in adults is at least 55 percent, and a mild reduction is defined as 45-54 percent

comment: definition of HP:0012665 (Moderately reduced ejection fraction)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system

The optic disc has an orange-pink rim with a pale centre (the cup) that does not contain neuroretinal tissue. An increase in this ratio therefoy may indicate a decrease in the quantity of healthy neuroretinal cells

comment: definition of HP:0025104 (Capillary malformation)  ; abnormality of the integument
source_value: A capillary malformation is a flat, sharply defined vascular stain of the skin. It may cover a large surface area or it may be scattered and appear as little islands of color. In a cpillary maformation, the predominant vessels are small, slow-flow vessels (i.e., arterioles and postcapillary venules)
translation_value: A capillary malformation is a flat, sharply defined vascular stain of the skin. It may cover a large surface area or it may be scattered and appear as little islands of color. In a cpillary maformation, the predominant vessels are small, slow-flow vessels (i.e., arterioles and postcapillary venules)

comment: definition of HP:0025105 (Nevus anemicus)  ; abnormality of the integument
source_value: A congenital skin lesion characterized by irregular hypopigmented macules that coalesce to form plaques and occur particularly on the chest. It is generally present at birth or develops in the first days of life. It is more common in females. Diagnosis is confirmed by applying gentle friction to the lesion and the surrounding skin and checking that the erythema produced in the healthy skin does not appear in the hypopigmented lesion. This pale macule becomes more conspicuous when the lesion and its surroundings are rubbed. The margin of the naevus is ill-defined and consists of an archipelago of small anaemic spots/
translation_value: A congenital skin lesion characterized by irregular hypopigmented macules that coalesce to form plaques and occur particularly on the chest. It is generally present at birth or develops in the first days of life. It is more common in females. Diagnosis is confirmed by applying gentle friction to the lesion and the surrounding skin and checking that the erythema produced in the healthy skin does not appear in the hypopigmented lesion. This pale macule becomes more conspicuous when the lesion and its surroundings are rubbed. The margin of the naevus is ill-defined and consists of an archipelago of small anaemic spots/

comment: definition of HP:0025109 (Reduced red cell pyruvate kinase activity)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis ; abnormality of blood and blood-forming tissues
source_value: Decrease in the activity of pyruvate kinase (PK) within erythrocytes. PK catalyzes the reaction: ATP + pyruvate = ADP + phosphoenolpyruvate
translation_value: Decrease in the activity of pyruvate kinase (PK) within erythrocytes. PK catalyzes the reaction: ATP + pyruvate = ADP + phosphoenolpyruvate

comment: definition of HP:0025125 (White lesion of the oral mucosa)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: White lesions of the oral mucosa are generally caused by a condition that increases the thickness of the epithelium. This increases the distance to the vascular bed and thereby tends to change the usual reddish color of the oral mucosa to white. Common causes include hyperkeratosis (thickening of the keratin layer), acanthosis (thickening of the spinous cell layer), increased edema in the epithelium (leukoedema), and reduced vascularity of the underlying lamina propria. Additionally, fibrin caps od surface ulcerations and collapsed bullae can appear white
translation_value: White lesions of the oral mucosa are generally caused by a condition that increases the thickness of the epithelium. This increases the distance to the vascular bed and thereby tends to change the usual reddish color of the oral mucosa to white. Common causes include hyperkeratosis (thickening of the keratin layer), acanthosis (thickening of the spinous cell layer), increased edema in the epithelium (leukoedema), and reduced vascularity of the underlying lamina propria. Additionally, fibrin caps od surface ulcerations and collapsed bullae can appear white
