comment: definition of HP:0025160 (Abnormal temper tantrums)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A temper tantrum is an emotional outburst usually triggered by a sense of frustration and manifested as whining and crying, screaming, kicking, hitting, and breath holding. Temper tantrums are normal in toddlers and young children and usually happen between the ages of one to three years. Temper tantrums may be considered abnormal if they occur at an unusually high frequency, are of unusual severity, or occur at an old age than usual
translation_value: A temper tantrum is an emotional outburst usually triggered by a sense of frustration and manifested as whining and crying, screaming, kicking, hitting, and breath holding. Temper tantrums are normal in toddlers and young children and usually happen between the ages of one to three years. Temper tantrums may be considered abnormal if they occur at an unusually high frequency, are of unusual severity, or occur at an old age than usual

comment: definition of HP:0025161 (Frequent temper tantrums)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Temper tantrums that occur more frequently than usual
translation_value: Temper tantrums that occur more frequently than usual

comment: definition of HP:0025162 (Severe temper tantrums)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Temper tantrums whose severity is more severe than usual. For instance, a temper tantrum might be considered to be severe if a child loses control so completely that the child cannot control the tantrum on its own, continuing until it becomes exhausted or a parent intervenes
translation_value: Temper tantrums whose severity is more severe than usual. For instance, a temper tantrum might be considered to be severe if a child loses control so completely that the child cannot control the tantrum on its own, continuing until it becomes exhausted or a parent intervenes

comment: label of HP:0025163 (Abnormality of optic chiasm morphology)  ; abnormality of the eye
translation_value: Anomalie de la morphologie du chiasma optique

comment: definition of HP:0025171 (Rosette-forming glioneuronal tumor)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; neoplasm
source_value: A tumor of the central nervous system that has components of both neurocytic and glial areas, whereby usually the glial component of the tumour predominates. Rossette-forming glioneuronal tumors (RGNT) have biphasic cytoarchitecture with two elements; neurocytic rosettes resembling Homer-Wright rosettes, and astrocytic component resembling a pilocytic astrocytoma. RGNTs are low-grade tumors that lack histopathological signs of malignancy
translation_value: A tumor of the central nervous system that has components of both neurocytic and glial areas, whereby usually the glial component of the tumour predominates. Rossette-forming glioneuronal tumors (RGNT) have biphasic cytoarchitecture with two elements; neurocytic rosettes resembling Homer-Wright rosettes, and astrocytic component resembling a pilocytic astrocytoma. RGNTs are low-grade tumors that lack histopathological signs of malignancy

comment: definition of HP:0025175 (Honeycomb lung)  ; abnormality of the respiratory system
source_value: Extensive interstitial fibrosis with alveolar disruption and bronchiolectasis
translation_value: Extensive interstitial fibrosis with alveolar disruption and bronchiolectasis

comment: definition of HP:0025176 (Intralobular interstitial thickening)  ; abnormality of the respiratory system
source_value: A fine reticular pattern on high-resolution computeed tomography, with the visible lines separated by a few millimeters. Regions of the lung with intralobular interstitial thickening characteristically show a fine lacelike or netlike appearance
translation_value: A fine reticular pattern on high-resolution computeed tomography, with the visible lines separated by a few millimeters. Regions of the lung with intralobular interstitial thickening characteristically show a fine lacelike or netlike appearance

comment: definition of HP:0025179 (Ground-glass opacification on pulmonary HRCT)  ; abnormality of the respiratory system
source_value: A descriptive term that is applied to computer tomography imaging and that refers to a hazy area of increased attenuation in the lung with preserved bronchial and vascular markings
translation_value: A descriptive term that is applied to computer tomography imaging and that refers to a hazy area of increased attenuation in the lung with preserved bronchial and vascular markings

comment: label of HP:0025179 (Ground-glass opacification on pulmonary HRCT)  ; abnormality of the respiratory system
translation_value: Opacification en verre dépoli sur la le TDM pulmonaire

comment: definition of HP:0025186 (Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Unilateral ptosis with associated upper eyelid contraction and contraction of either the external or the internal pterygoid muscle. It is thought to occur because of congenital miswiring of a branch of the fifth cranial nerve into the branch of the third cranial nerve supplying the levator muscle. In Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis, elevation and even retraction of the affected eyelid is triggered by chewing, suction, lateral mandible movement, smiling, sternocleidomastoid contraction, protruding tongue, Valsalva manoeuvre and even by breathing
translation_value: Unilateral ptosis with associated upper eyelid contraction and contraction of either the external or the internal pterygoid muscle. It is thought to occur because of congenital miswiring of a branch of the fifth cranial nerve into the branch of the third cranial nerve supplying the levator muscle. In Marcus Gunn jaw winking synkinesis, elevation and even retraction of the affected eyelid is triggered by chewing, suction, lateral mandible movement, smiling, sternocleidomastoid contraction, protruding tongue, Valsalva manoeuvre and even by breathing

translation_value: A type of generalized tonic-clonic seizure that occurs in and rapidly engages bilaterally distributed networks

comment: definition of HP:0025233 (Sleep paralysis)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: An inability to move the body at sleep onset or upon awakening from sleep lasting seconds to a few minutes
translation_value: An inability to move the body at sleep onset or upon awakening from sleep lasting seconds to a few minutes

comment: definition of HP:0025234 (Parasomnia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: An undesirable physical event or experience that occur during entry into sleep, during sleep, or during arousal from sleep
translation_value: An undesirable physical event or experience that occur during entry into sleep, during sleep, or during arousal from sleep

comment: definition of HP:0025235 (Non-rapid eye movement parasomnia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A parasomnia that occurs in non-rapid eye movement (NREM) sleep. This refers to a disorder of arousal that occurs during slow-wave sleep (ie, NREM stage 3 sleep)
translation_value: A parasomnia that occurs in non-rapid eye movement (NREM) sleep. This refers to a disorder of arousal that occurs during slow-wave sleep (ie, NREM stage 3 sleep)

comment: label of HP:0025235 (Non-rapid eye movement parasomnia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Parasomnie à mouvements oculaires non rapides

comment: definition of HP:0025236 (Somnambulism)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Ambulation or other complex motor behaviors after getting out of bed in a sleep-like state. During sleepwalking episodes, the sonambulating individual appears confused or dazed, the eyes are usually open, and he or she might mumble or give inappropriate answers to questions, or occasionally appear agitated
translation_value: Ambulation or other complex motor behaviors after getting out of bed in a sleep-like state. During sleepwalking episodes, the sonambulating individual appears confused or dazed, the eyes are usually open, and he or she might mumble or give inappropriate answers to questions, or occasionally appear agitated

comment: label of HP:0025236 (Somnambulism)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Somnambulisme

comment: label of HP:0025237 (Confusional arousal)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Éveil confusionnel

comment: definition of HP:0025247 (Dermoid cyst)  ; abnormality of the integument
source_value: A congenital subcutaneous cyst that arises from entrapment of skin along the lines of embryonic fusion. In contrast to epidermal cysts, dermoid cysts tend to contain various adnexal structures such as hair, sebaceous, eccrine or apocrine glands. Dermoid cysts are present at birth, and are indolent, firm, deep, subcutaneous nodules. They are often located on the head and neck, and rarely in the anogenital area. Dermoid cysts arenslowly progressive and can grow to a size of 1 to 4 cm
translation_value: A congenital subcutaneous cyst that arises from entrapment of skin along the lines of embryonic fusion. In contrast to epidermal cysts, dermoid cysts tend to contain various adnexal structures such as hair, sebaceous, eccrine or apocrine glands. Dermoid cysts are present at birth, and are indolent, firm, deep, subcutaneous nodules. They are often located on the head and neck, and rarely in the anogenital area. Dermoid cysts arenslowly progressive and can grow to a size of 1 to 4 cm

comment: definition of HP:0025253 (Claustrophobia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: An abnormal fear of being in a closed or narrow space with no escape
translation_value: An abnormal fear of being in a closed or narrow space with no escape

comment: label of HP:0025266 (Cervical osteoarthritis)  ; abnormality of the skeletal system
translation_value: Arthrose cervicale

comment: definition of HP:0025267 (Snoring)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; abnormality of the respiratory system
source_value: Deep, noisy breathing during sleep accompanied by hoarse or harsh sounds caused by the vibration of respiratory structures (especially the soft palate) resulting in sound due to obstructed air movement during breathing while sleeping
translation_value: Deep, noisy breathing during sleep accompanied by hoarse or harsh sounds caused by the vibration of respiratory structures (especially the soft palate) resulting in sound due to obstructed air movement during breathing while sleeping

comment: definition of HP:0025269 (Panic attack)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A sudden episode of intense fear in a situation in which there is no danger or apparent cause. The panic attack is accompanied by symptoms such as palpitations, sweating and chills or hot flushes. There may be a sensation of dyspnea (being out of breath), chest pain, or abdominal distress. Some indiviudals with panic attacks may experience depersonalization, a fear of going crazy, or a fear of dying
translation_value: A sudden episode of intense fear in a situation in which there is no danger or apparent cause. The panic attack is accompanied by symptoms such as palpitations, sweating and chills or hot flushes. There may be a sensation of dyspnea (being out of breath), chest pain, or abdominal distress. Some indiviudals with panic attacks may experience depersonalization, a fear of going crazy, or a fear of dying

translation_value: Anomalie de la physiologie de l'œsophage

comment: definition of HP:0025451 (Testicular adrenal rest tumor)  ; abnormality of the genitourinary system ; neoplasm
source_value: Testicular adrenal rest tumor (TART) isa abenign tumor of the testis. TART generally occurs multiply and bilaterally within the rete testis. Histologically, TART resemble adrenocortical tissue, which led to the name. The tumous are not encapsulated and consist of sheets or confluent cords of large polygonal cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm
translation_value: Testicular adrenal rest tumor (TART) isa abenign tumor of the testis. TART generally occurs multiply and bilaterally within the rete testis. Histologically, TART resemble adrenocortical tissue, which led to the name. The tumous are not encapsulated and consist of sheets or confluent cords of large polygonal cells with abundant eosinophilic cytoplasm

comment: definition of HP:0025453 (Delayed adrenarche)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system ; growth abnormality
source_value: Occurence of adrenarche at a later than normal age. Adrenarche normally occurs between six and eight years of age with increased adrenal androgen secretion; its exact biologic role is not well understood. It is accompanied by changes in pilosebaceous units, a transient growth spurt and the appearance of axillary and pubic hair in some children, but no sexual development
translation_value: Occurence of adrenarche at a later than normal age. Adrenarche normally occurs between six and eight years of age with increased adrenal androgen secretion; its exact biologic role is not well understood. It is accompanied by changes in pilosebaceous units, a transient growth spurt and the appearance of axillary and pubic hair in some children, but no sexual development

comment: definition of HP:0025482 (Positive perchlorate discharge test)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: An abnormal result of the perchlorate discharge test. In this test, first radioactive iodine is administered, sufficinet time is allowed to pass so that the radioactive iodine is captured by the thyroid,and then, perchlorate is administered orally. The perchlorate displaces non-organified iodide from the thyroid. The perchlorate dischanrge test is considered positive (abnormal) if there is an abnormally rapid loss of radioactive iodine from the thyroid
translation_value: An abnormal result of the perchlorate discharge test. In this test, first radioactive iodine is administered, sufficinet time is allowed to pass so that the radioactive iodine is captured by the thyroid,and then, perchlorate is administered orally. The perchlorate displaces non-organified iodide from the thyroid. The perchlorate dischanrge test is considered positive (abnormal) if there is an abnormally rapid loss of radioactive iodine from the thyroid

comment: definition of HP:0025553 (Periorbital ecchymosis with tarsal plate sparing)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: Subcutaneous bleeding with a diamter greater than 1 cm (ecchymosis). The bleeding does not extend into the tarsal plate (the comparatively thick, elongated plates of dense connective tissue within the eyelid) due to an anatomic structure called the orbital septum, which limits extravasation of blood beyond the tarsal plate
translation_value: Subcutaneous bleeding with a diamter greater than 1 cm (ecchymosis). The bleeding does not extend into the tarsal plate (the comparatively thick, elongated plates of dense connective tissue within the eyelid) due to an anatomic structure called the orbital septum, which limits extravasation of blood beyond the tarsal plate

comment: definition of HP:0025559 (Coronary cataract)  ; abnormality of the eye

translation_value: A type of cataract characterised by club-shaped and dot opacities distributed radially in the deep cortex. These lens opacities surround the nucleus in an appearance that is though to resemble a crown

comment: definition of HP:0025567 (Central serous chorioretinopathy)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: An anomaly of the retina with serous detachment of the neurosensory retina secondary to one or more focal lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE), and associated with blurred vision, usually in one eye only and perceived typically by the patient as a dark spot in the centre of the visual field with associated micropsia and metamorphopsia. Normal vision often recurs spontaneously within a few months
translation_value: An anomaly of the retina with serous detachment of the neurosensory retina secondary to one or more focal lesions of the retinal pigment epithelium (RPE), and associated with blurred vision, usually in one eye only and perceived typically by the patient as a dark spot in the centre of the visual field with associated micropsia and metamorphopsia. Normal vision often recurs spontaneously within a few months

comment: definition of HP:0025571 (Christmas tree cataract)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: A type of cataract that shows a spectacular display of multiple colours that glitters with the change of incident light like an illuminated Christmas tree
translation_value: A type of cataract that shows a spectacular display of multiple colours that glitters with the change of incident light like an illuminated Christmas tree

translation_value: Tendency for the visual ais of one eye to be higher than that of the other

comment: definition of HP:0025594 (Superior oblique muscle overaction)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: An ocular motility abnormality characterized by an overacting superior oblique muscle resulting to vertical incomitance of the eyes in lateral gaze. On examination, this is commonly seen as a downshoot of the adducting eye occuring when gaze is directed into the field of action of the inferior oblique muscle, producing a greater downward excursion of the adducted eye than of the abducted eye
translation_value: An ocular motility abnormality characterized by an overacting superior oblique muscle resulting to vertical incomitance of the eyes in lateral gaze. On examination, this is commonly seen as a downshoot of the adducting eye occuring when gaze is directed into the field of action of the inferior oblique muscle, producing a greater downward excursion of the adducted eye than of the abducted eye

translation_value: A type of blepharitis that affects the meibomian glands and meobomian gland orifices. comment: definition of HP:0030223 (Perseveration)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Perseveration can be defined as the contextually inappropriate and unintentional repetition of a response or behavioral unit. In other words, the observed repetitiveness does not meet the demands of the situation, is not the product of deliberation, and may even unfold despite counterintention. Perseveration can therefore be differentiated from goal-directed and intentional forms of repetition, such as linguistic redundancies designed to enhance communicative or poetic impact
translation_value: Perseveration can be defined as the contextually inappropriate and unintentional repetition of a response or behavioral unit. In other words, the observed repetitiveness does not meet the demands of the situation, is not the product of deliberation, and may even unfold despite counterintention. translation_value: Any deivation from the normal concentration in the blood circulation of a thromboxane. Thromboxanes are derived from prostaglandin precursors in platelets, and stimulate aggregation of platelets and constriction of blood vessels

comment: definition of HP:0030406 (Primary peritoneal carcinoma)  ; abnormality of the digestive system ; neoplasm
source_value: A type of cancer that originates in the peritoneam. It is to be distinguished from metastatic cancer of the peritoneum. Peritoneal cancer can occur anywhere in the abdominal space, and affects the surface of organs contained inside the peritoneum
translation_value: A type of cancer that originates in the peritoneam. It is to be distinguished from metastatic cancer of the peritoneum. Peritoneal cancer can occur anywhere in the abdominal space, and affects the surface of organs contained inside the peritoneum

comment: definition of HP:0030407 (Pineocytoma)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; neoplasm
source_value: A type of pineal parenchymal cell neoplasm that is a mature well-differentiated tumour (WHO grade I)
translation_value: A type of pineal parenchymal cell neoplasm that is a mature well-differentiated tumour (WHO grade I)

comment: definition of HP:0030408 (Pineoblastoma)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; neoplasm
source_value: Pineoblastoma is a rare primitive neuroectodermal tumour (PNET) arising in the pineal gland. Pineoblastomas are classified as a WHO grade IV tumour and comprise one-fourth to one-half of pineal parenchymal tumours. Pineoblastoma is a highly cellular tumor originating in the pineal gland and containing small, poorly differentiated cells
translation_value: Pineoblastoma is a rare primitive neuroectodermal tumour (PNET) arising in the pineal gland. Pineoblastomas are classified as a WHO grade IV tumour and comprise one-fourth to one-half of pineal parenchymal tumours. Pineoblastoma is a highly cellular tumor originating in the pineal gland and containing small, poorly differentiated cells

source_value: A cancer that originates in the sqamous cells that line the surface of the vulva

translation_value: Anomalie de la vascularisation maculaire

comment: definition of HP:0030497 (Macular cotton wool spot)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Fluffy white patch on the macula, representing localized areas of dense white swelling of the retinal nerve fibre layer. They often have a zigzag internal structure, a feathered edge but an otherwise well-delineated form and an approximately 1 mm dimension; they project slightly into the vitreous and sometimes deflect retinal vessels
translation_value: Fluffy white patch on the macula, representing localized areas of dense white swelling of the retinal nerve fibre layer. They often have a zigzag internal structure, a feathered edge but an otherwise well-delineated form and an approximately 1 mm dimension; they project slightly into the vitreous and sometimes deflect retinal vessels

translation_value: Hémangiome caverneux rétinien

comment: definition of HP:0030515 (Moderately reduced visual acuity)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Moderate reduction of the ability to see defined as visual acuity less than 6/18 (20/60 in US notation; 0.5 in decimal notation) but at least 6/60 (20/200 in US notation; 0.1 in decimal notation)
translation_value: Moderate reduction of the ability to see defined as visual acuity less than 6/18 (20/60 in US notation; 0.5 in decimal notation) but at least 6/60 (20/200 in US notation; 0.1 in decimal notation)

translation_value: Anomalie du test de périmétrie sur grille d'Estermann

comment: definition of HP:0030636 (Occult macular dystrophy)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Occult macular dystrophy is a, typically hereditary, abnormality of the macula associated with progressive foveal cone dysfunction and no apparent fundoscopic, full-field electoretinogram (ERG), or fluorescein angiogram abnormalities
translation_value: Occult macular dystrophy is a, typically hereditary, abnormality of the macula associated with progressive foveal cone dysfunction and no apparent fundoscopic, full-field electoretinogram (ERG), or fluorescein angiogram abnormalities

comment: definition of HP:0030637 (Congenital stationary cone dysfunction)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Retinal phenotype characterised by cone photoreceptor dysfunction and preserved rod system. The abnormality is typically stationary or very slowly progressive and findings may include reduced central vision, colour vision abnormalities, nystagmus and photophobia
translation_value: Retinal phenotype characterised by cone photoreceptor dysfunction and preserved rod system. The abnormality is typically stationary or very slowly progressive and findings may include reduced central vision, colour vision abnormalities, nystagmus and photophobia

comment: label of HP:0030644 (Blind-spot enlargment)  ; abnormality of the eye
translation_value: Enlargement de la tâche aveugle

comment: definition of HP:0030663 (Optically empty vitreous)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Vestigial vitreous gel occupying the immediate retrolental space and minimal to no discernable gel in the central vitreous cavity, giving the appearance of an empty vitreous cavity
translation_value: Vestigial vitreous gel occupying the immediate retrolental space and minimal to no discernable gel in the central vitreous cavity, giving the appearance of an empty vitreous cavity

comment: definition of HP:0030664 (Beevor's sign)  ; abnormality of the musculature ; abnormality of the digestive system
source_value: Weakness of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, which is ascertained clinically as follows. When a patient sits up or raises the head from a recumbent position, the umbilicus is displaced toward the head. This is the result of paralysis of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, so that the upper fibres predominate pulling upwards the umbilicus
translation_value: Weakness of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, which is ascertained clinically as follows. When a patient sits up or raises the head from a recumbent position, the umbilicus is displaced toward the head. This is the result of paralysis of the inferior portion of the rectus abdominal muscle, so that the upper fibres predominate pulling upwards the umbilicus

comment: definition of HP:0030671 (Abnormal common tendinous ring morphology)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: Any anomaly of the ring of fibrous tissue that surrounds the optic nerve at its entrance at the apex of the orbit. The common tendinous ring, also know as the annulus of Zinn or annular tendon, is the origin for five of the seven extraocular muscles
translation_value: Any anomaly of the ring of fibrous tissue that surrounds the optic nerve at its entrance at the apex of the orbit. The common tendinous ring, also know as the annulus of Zinn or annular tendon, is the origin for five of the seven extraocular muscles

translation_value: Anomalie morphologique du système cardiovasculaire

comment: definition of HP:0030683 (Vaginitis)  ; abnormality of the genitourinary system ; abnormality of the immune system
source_value: Inflammation of the vagina that can result from a spectrum of conditions that cause vaginal and sometimes vulvar symptoms, such as itching, burning, irritation, odor, and vaginal discharge
translation_value: Inflammation of the vagina that can result from a spectrum of conditions that cause vaginal and sometimes vulvar symptoms, such as itching, burning, irritation, odor, and vaginal discharge

comment: definition of HP:0030713 (Vein of Galen aneurysmal malformation)  ; abnormality of the nervous system ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Gross dilatation of the vein of Galen, being fed by large anomalous vessel or vessels arising from the carotid or basilar circulation
translation_value: Gross dilatation of the vein of Galen, being fed by large anomalous vessel or vessels arising from the carotid or basilar circulation

comment: definition of HP:0030715 (Bronchial atresia)  ; abnormality of the respiratory system
source_value: A developmental anomaly characterised by focal obliteration of the proximal segment of a bronchus. The bronchial pattern is entirely normal distal to the site of stenosis
translation_value: A developmental anomaly characterised by focal obliteration of the proximal segment of a bronchus. The bronchial pattern is entirely normal distal to the site of stenosis

comment: definition of HP:0030743 (Glial remnants anterior to the optic disc)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Persistanced of a posterior remnant of the hyaloid artery located at the optic disc
translation_value: Persistanced of a posterior remnant of the hyaloid artery located at the optic disc

comment: definition of HP:0030744 (Hyaloid vascular remnant and retrolental mass)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: A type of persistance of the hyaloid vascular system associated with a retrolental mass that may lead to fetal cataract
translation_value: A type of persistance of the hyaloid vascular system associated with a retrolental mass that may lead to fetal cataract

comment: definition of HP:0030745 (Dilatation of the ductus arteriosus)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A saccular or fusiform dilation and elongation of the ductus arteriosus
translation_value: A saccular or fusiform dilation and elongation of the ductus arteriosus

comment: definition of HP:0030762 (Mesangiolysis)  ; abnormality of the genitourinary system
source_value: Dissolution or attenuation of mesangial matrix and degeneration of mesangial cells. In essence, mesangiolysis is an injurious process which affects the glomerular mesangium without causing obvious damage to the capillary basement membranes. The matrix swells, loosens, and eventually dissolves; the mesangial cells may show only edema and vacuolization, or may undergo severe degeneration and necrosis
translation_value: Dissolution or attenuation of mesangial matrix and degeneration of mesangial cells. In essence, mesangiolysis is an injurious process which affects the glomerular mesangium without causing obvious damage to the capillary basement membranes. The matrix swells, loosens, and eventually dissolves; the mesangial cells may show only edema and vacuolization, or may undergo severe degeneration and necrosis

comment: definition of HP:0030764 (Ochronosis)  ; abnormality of the integument
source_value: Brown or blue-gray discoloration of the skin tha can present on the axillary and inguinal areas, face, palms or soles. In addition, blue-black discoloration can be apparent on skin overlying cartilage in which the pigment is deposited, such as the ears. This is a characteristic manifestation of alkaptonuria, which is an autosomal recessively inherited deficiency of homogentisic acid oxidase that results in accumulation of homogentisic acid in collagenous structures. The sclerae are also typically involved
translation_value: Brown or blue-gray discoloration of the skin tha can present on the axillary and inguinal areas, face, palms or soles. In addition, blue-black discoloration can be apparent on skin overlying cartilage in which the pigment is deposited, such as the ears. This is a characteristic manifestation of alkaptonuria, which is an autosomal recessively inherited deficiency of homogentisic acid oxidase that results in accumulation of homogentisic acid in collagenous structures. The sclerae are also typically involved

comment: definition of HP:0030765 (Sleep terror)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Episodes of intense fear, screaming and flailing although affected individuals are still asleep
translation_value: Episodes of intense fear, screaming and flailing although affected individuals are still asleep

comment: definition of HP:0030778 (Modic type III vertebral endplate changes)  ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate with a low signal on T1 and T2-weighted sequences. Modif type III signals are thought to correspond to subchondral sclerosis seen on plain radiographs
translation_value: An abnormal magnetic resonance tomography signal from a vertebral endplate with a low signal on T1 and T2-weighted sequences. Modif type III signals are thought to correspond to subchondral sclerosis seen on plain radiographs

comment: definition of HP:0030790 (Abnormal cerumen color)  ; abnormality of the ear
source_value: An anomolous earwax color. Earwax (cerumen) is usually light to dark brown or orange in color
translation_value: An anomolous earwax color. Earwax (cerumen) is usually light to dark brown or orange in color

comment: definition of HP:0030794 (Abnormal C-peptide level)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
source_value: An anomolous circulating concentration of the connecting (C) peptide, which links the insulin A and B chains in proinsulin, providing thereby a means to promote their efficient folding and assembly in the endoplasmic reticulum during insulin biosynthesis. After cleavage of proinsulin, C-peptide is stored with insulin in the soluble phase of the secretory granules and is subsequently released in equimolar amounts with insulin, providing a useful independent indicator of insulin secretion
translation_value: An anomolous circulating concentration of the connecting (C) peptide, which links the insulin A and B chains in proinsulin, providing thereby a means to promote their efficient folding and assembly in the endoplasmic reticulum during insulin biosynthesis. After cleavage of proinsulin, C-peptide is stored with insulin in the soluble phase of the secretory granules and is subsequently released in equimolar amounts with insulin, providing a useful independent indicator of insulin secretion

translation_value: Taux anormal de peptide C

comment: definition of HP:0030818 (Central nail canal)  ; abnormality of the integument

translation_value: The presense of a depressed line ("canal") in the center of the nail

comment: definition of HP:0030858 (Addictive behavior)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A recurrent pattern of behavior that is characeterized by the failure to resist an impulse, drive, or temptation to perform an act that is harmful to the person or to others. The repetitive engagement in these behaviors ultimately interferes with functioning in other domains
translation_value: A recurrent pattern of behavior that is characeterized by the failure to resist an impulse, drive, or temptation to perform an act that is harmful to the person or to others. The repetitive engagement in these behaviors ultimately interferes with functioning in other domains

translation_value: Taux élevé d'amyloïdes dans le LCR

comment: definition of HP:0030905 (Snout reflex)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by tapping the upper lip lightly. The contraction of the muscles causes the mouth to resemble a snout [NCBI Books:NBK395]
translation_value: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by tapping the upper lip lightly. The contraction of the muscles causes the mouth to resemble a snout [NCBI Books:NBK395]

comment: definition of HP:0030906 (Suck reflex)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by lightly touching or tapping on the lips with an object such as a tongue blade, reflex hammer, or the examiner's finger. At times the reflex is obtained merely by approaching the lips with an object. A positive suck reflex consists of sucking movements by the lips when they are stroked or touched [NCBI Books:NBK395]
translation_value: A type of primitive reflex that is elicited by lightly touching or tapping on the lips with an object such as a tongue blade, reflex hammer, or the examiner's finger. At times the reflex is obtained merely by approaching the lips with an object. A positive suck reflex consists of sucking movements by the lips when they are stroked or touched [NCBI Books:NBK395]

source_value: Abnormality of intestinal smooth muscle morphology

comment: definition of HP:0030948 (Elevated gamma-glutamyltransferase activity)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
source_value: Increased activity of the enzyme gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT). GGT is mainly present in kidney, liver, and pancreatic cells, but small amounts are present in other tissues
translation_value: Increased activity of the enzyme gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT). GGT is mainly present in kidney, liver, and pancreatic cells, but small amounts are present in other tissues

comment: label of HP:0030948 (Elevated gamma-glutamyltransferase activity)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
translation_value: Activité gamma-glutamyltransférase élevée

comment: definition of HP:0030952 (Birdshot choroidal lesions)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Multiple cream-yellow colored hypopigmented choroidal anomalies whose size is approximately one quarter to one half of that of the optic disc, and whose location tends to cluster around the optic nerve radiating towards the periphery. The pattern of the lesions is said to be similar to gunshot spatter from birdshot
translation_value: Multiple cream-yellow colored hypopigmented choroidal anomalies whose size is approximately one quarter to one half of that of the optic disc, and whose location tends to cluster around the optic nerve radiating towards the periphery. The pattern of the lesions is said to be similar to gunshot spatter from birdshot

comment: label of HP:0030952 (Birdshot choroidal lesions)  ; abnormality of the eye
translation_value: Lésions choroïdiennes de type Birdshot

comment: definition of HP:0030955 (Alcoholism)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: An addictive behavior defined as drinking excessive amounts of alcohol over a long period of time, having difficulty reducing the amount of alcohol consumed, strongly desiring alcohol and experiencing withdrawal symoptoms when not drinking alcohol
translation_value: An addictive behavior defined as drinking excessive amounts of alcohol over a long period of time, having difficulty reducing the amount of alcohol consumed, strongly desiring alcohol and experiencing withdrawal symoptoms when not drinking alcohol

comment: label of HP:0030955 (Alcoholism)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Alcoolisme

comment: definition of HP:0030957 (Ventricular septal aneurysm)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A bowing (bulding to one side) of the interventricular septum of more than 15 mm on either side in adults and 5 mm in children during normal cardiac motion
translation_value: A bowing (bulding to one side) of the interventricular septum of more than 15 mm on either side in adults and 5 mm in children during normal cardiac motion

comment: definition of HP:0030961 (Microspherophakia)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Lens of the eye is smaller than normal and spherically shaped
translation_value: Lens of the eye is smaller than normal and spherically shaped

comment: definition of HP:0030973 (Postexertional malaise)  ; constitutional symptom
source_value: A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation and that is induced by exertion or exercise
translation_value: A subjective feeling of tiredness characterized by a lack of energy and motivation and that is induced by exertion or exercise

comment: label of HP:0030973 (Postexertional malaise)  ; constitutional symptom
translation_value: Malaise après l'effort

comment: definition of HP:0030974 (Cryptozoospermia)  ; abnormality of the genitourinary system
source_value: A type of low sperm count where ejaculated semen contains less than 100,000 spermatozoa per ml. With cryptozoospermia, the sperm count may fluctuate and a zero sperm count in the ejaculate may be initially measured. If sperm are observed in a second semen sample following centrifugation, the diagnosis of cryptozoospermia can be made (and azoospermia can be ruled out)
translation_value: A type of low sperm count where ejaculated semen contains less than 100,000 spermatozoa per ml. With cryptozoospermia, the sperm count may fluctuate and a zero sperm count in the ejaculate may be initially measured. If sperm are observed in a second semen sample following centrifugation, the diagnosis of cryptozoospermia can be made (and azoospermia can be ruled out)

comment: definition of HP:0030981 (Abnormal CSF/serum albumin ratio)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A deviation from the normal range of the ratio of the albumin concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) to the concentration in serum (which may be defined as 3.2-9.0). This is an index of blood-brain barrier (BBB) integrity, adjusted for the serum albumin concentration, and an increased ratio is taken as a sign of a loss of integretiy of the BBB with leakage of albumin into the CSF
translation_value: A deviation from the normal range of the ratio of the albumin concentration in the cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) to the concentration in serum (which may be defined as 3.2-9.0). This is an index of blood-brain barrier (BBB) integrity, adjusted for the serum albumin concentration, and an increased ratio is taken as a sign of a loss of integretiy of the BBB with leakage of albumin into the CSF

comment: label of HP:0030985 (Decreased serum bile concentration)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
translation_value: Diminution de la concentration sérique de bile

comment: definition of HP:0030992 (Abnormal pancreatic duct morphology)  ; abnormality of the digestive system
source_value: Any structural anomaly of the pancreatic duct, which is the tubular structure that collects exocrine pancreatic secretions and and transports them to the duodenum
translation_value: Any structural anomaly of the pancreatic duct, which is the tubular structure that collects exocrine pancreatic secretions and and transports them to the duodenum

comment: label of HP:0030995 (Peritoneal effusion)  ; abnormality of the digestive system
translation_value: Épanchement péritonéal

comment: definition of HP:0031001 (Minifascicle formation)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A nerve fascicle or fasciculus is a small bundle of axons, enclosed by the perineurium. A minifascule refers to a group of thinly myelinated and unmyelinated axons surrounded by a delicate perineurium, and with a smaller diamter than a normal nerve fascicle
translation_value: A nerve fascicle or fasciculus is a small bundle of axons, enclosed by the perineurium. A minifascule refers to a group of thinly myelinated and unmyelinated axons surrounded by a delicate perineurium, and with a smaller diamter than a normal nerve fascicle

comment: definition of HP:0031003 (Polyneuritis)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Simulataneous inflammation of multiple nerves

comment: label of HP:0031005 (Hyperalgesia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
translation_value: Hyperalgésie

comment: definition of HP:0031010 (Hyperphalangy of the 3rd finger)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: An accessory phalanx of the third (middle) finger that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. Hyperphalangy results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint, resulting in radial deviation of the finger
translation_value: An accessory phalanx of the third (middle) finger that is arranged linearly with the other phalanges. Hyperphalangy results from an accessory ossification center at the metacarpophalangeal joint, resulting in radial deviation of the finger

comment: definition of HP:0031012 (Thin-cap fibroatheroma)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Thin-cap fibroatheroma is characterized by a relatively large necrotic core with an overlying thin fibrous cap measuring <65 µm typically containing numerous macrophages, and is considered to be the precursor lesion of plaque rupture which is the most common cause of coronary thrombosis
translation_value: Thin-cap fibroatheroma is characterized by a relatively large necrotic core with an overlying thin fibrous cap measuring <65 µm typically containing numerous macrophages, and is considered to be the precursor lesion of plaque rupture which is the most common cause of coronary thrombosis

comment: label of HP:0031014 (Arteria lusoria)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
translation_value: Arteria lusoria

comment: definition of HP:0031025 (Gastric leiomyosarcoma)  ; abnormality of the digestive system ; neoplasm
source_value: A malignant neoplasm of the stomach that grows submocosally in the gastric wall. Necrosis and hemorrhage may be visible radiologically. Histologically, spindle cells with abnormal mitotic activity may be visible
translation_value: A malignant neoplasm of the stomach that grows submocosally in the gastric wall. Necrosis and hemorrhage may be visible radiologically. Histologically, spindle cells with abnormal mitotic activity may be visible

comment: definition of HP:0031029 (Elevated carcinoembryonic antigen level)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
source_value: An increased blood concentration of the carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA). CEA is a member of the immunoglobulin supergene family. The human CEA gene family is clustered on chromosome 19q and comprises 29 genes. CEA is highly expressed in embryonic tissue and in some cancers, and is a widely used tumor marker
translation_value: An increased blood concentration of the carcinoembryonic antigen (CEA). CEA is a member of the immunoglobulin supergene family. The human CEA gene family is clustered on chromosome 19q and comprises 29 genes. CEA is highly expressed in embryonic tissue and in some cancers, and is a widely used tumor marker

translation_value: Taux élevé d'antigène carcino-embryonnaire

source_value: A type of maturation arrest in which only spermatogonia or spermatocytes are found

comment: label of HP:0031039 (Early spermatogenesis maturation arrest)  ; abnormality of the genitourinary system
translation_value: Arrêt de la maturation de la spermatogenèse précoce

translation_value: A type of maturation arrest in which spermatids are detected without spermatozoa

translation_value: Arrêt de la maturation de la spermatogenèse tardive

comment: definition of HP:0031042 (Strawberry tongue)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: Inflammed tongue with hyperplastic (enlarged) fungiform papillae that is said to resemble a strawberry or raspberry
translation_value: Inflammed tongue with hyperplastic (enlarged) fungiform papillae that is said to resemble a strawberry or raspberry

comment: label of HP:0031068 (Increased femoral torsion)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
translation_value: Augmentation de la torsion fémorale

comment: definition of HP:0031069 (Abnormal femoral torsion)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: Femoral torsion, also known as femoral rotation or femoral version, refers to the twist between the proximal and distal parts of the femur on the transverse plane. Femoral anteversion averages between 30-40 degress at birth, and between 8-14 degrees in adults. This term applies if the amount of femoral torsion deviates from this range
translation_value: Femoral torsion, also known as femoral rotation or femoral version, refers to the twist between the proximal and distal parts of the femur on the transverse plane. Femoral anteversion averages between 30-40 degress at birth, and between 8-14 degrees in adults. This term applies if the amount of femoral torsion deviates from this range

comment: label of HP:0031070 (Decreased femoral torsion)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
translation_value: Diminution de la torsion fémorale

comment: definition of HP:0031074 (Abnormal response to ACTH stimulation test)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: An anomolous response to stimulation by adminstration of the adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH). ACTH stimulation normally stimulates the adrenal glands to release cortisol and adrenaline
translation_value: An anomolous response to stimulation by adminstration of the adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH). ACTH stimulation normally stimulates the adrenal glands to release cortisol and adrenaline

comment: definition of HP:0031075 (Abnormal response to insulin tolerance test)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: An anomalous response to the insulin tolerance test (ITT), in which insulin is administered intravenously and blood glucose and potentially other compounds are measred at intervals. Insulin administration is intended to induce extreme hypoglycemia (bloodgluoce below 40 mg/dl), which in turn induces release of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH). ACTH induces the adrenal gland to release cortisol, which together with GH opposes the action of insulin on the blood glucose level
translation_value: An anomalous response to the insulin tolerance test (ITT), in which insulin is administered intravenously and blood glucose and potentially other compounds are measred at intervals. Insulin administration is intended to induce extreme hypoglycemia (bloodgluoce below 40 mg/dl), which in turn induces release of adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH) and growth hormone (GH). ACTH induces the adrenal gland to release cortisol, which together with GH opposes the action of insulin on the blood glucose level

comment: definition of HP:0031085 (Decreased prealbumin level)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
source_value: A reduced concentration of prealbumin in the blood. Prealbumin, also known as transthyretin, has a half-life in plasma of about 2 days, much shorter than that of albumin. Prealbumin is therefore more sensitive to changes in protein-energy status than albumin, and its concentration closely reflects recent dietary intake rather than overall nutritional status
translation_value: A reduced concentration of prealbumin in the blood. Prealbumin, also known as transthyretin, has a half-life in plasma of about 2 days, much shorter than that of albumin. Prealbumin is therefore more sensitive to changes in protein-energy status than albumin, and its concentration closely reflects recent dietary intake rather than overall nutritional status

comment: label of HP:0031085 (Decreased prealbumin level)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis
translation_value: Diminution du taux de préalbumine

source_value: Any anomaly of the structure of the humerus
translation_value: Any anomaly of the structure of the humerus

comment: definition of HP:0031099 (Abnormal circulating inhibin level)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: Any deviation from the normal concentration of iInhibins, which are heterodimeric protein hormones secreted by granulosa cells of the ovary in females and Sertoli cells of the testis in males. Inhibins suppress the secretion of pituitary follicle-stimulating hormone
translation_value: Any deviation from the normal concentration of iInhibins, which are heterodimeric protein hormones secreted by granulosa cells of the ovary in females and Sertoli cells of the testis in males. Inhibins suppress the secretion of pituitary follicle-stimulating hormone

translation_value: Diminution du taux d'inhibine B

translation_value: Anomalie du taux d'hormone antimüllerienne

translation_value: Diminution du taux d'hormone antimüllérienne

translation_value: Exposition anormale de la phosphatidylsérine plaquettaire

comment: definition of HP:0031134 (Cor triatrium sinister)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A developmental anomaly of the heart characterizedby the presence of three atria because the left atrium is divided by an abnormal septum
translation_value: A developmental anomaly of the heart characterizedby the presence of three atria because the left atrium is divided by an abnormal septum

comment: label of HP:0031134 (Cor triatrium sinister)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
translation_value: Cor triatrium sinister

translation_value: Taux anormal de peptide natriurétique de type B

comment: definition of HP:0031179 (Nuchal rigidity)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: Resistnace of the extensor muscles of the neck to being bent forwards (i.e., impaired neck flexion) as a result of muscle spasm of the extensor muscles of the neck. Nuchal rigidity is not a fixed rigidity. Nuchal rigidity has been used as a bedside test for meningism, although its sensitivity for this purpose has been debated
translation_value: Resistnace of the extensor muscles of the neck to being bent forwards (i.e., impaired neck flexion) as a result of muscle spasm of the extensor muscles of the neck. Nuchal rigidity is not a fixed rigidity. Nuchal rigidity has been used as a bedside test for meningism, although its sensitivity for this purpose has been debated

translation_value: Augmentation du taux de NT-proBNP

translation_value: Anomalie du taux de prégnénolone circulant

comment: definition of HP:0031190 (Superficial dermal perivascular inflammatory infiltrate)  ; abnormality of the integument ; abnormality of the immune system
source_value: Numerous lymphocytes surrounding blood vessels in the superfical part of the dermis
translation_value: Numerous lymphocytes surrounding blood vessels in the superfical part of the dermis

comment: definition of HP:0031194 (Increased density of left ventricular trabeculae)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: An increased denisty (number and tightness) of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the left ventricles of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae)
translation_value: An increased denisty (number and tightness) of the muscular columns which project from the inner surface of the left ventricles of the heart (cardiac trabeculae, trabeculae carneae)

comment: definition of HP:0031195 (Apical hypertrabeculation of the left ventricle)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: An increased number and denisty of the trabeculae in the apex (tip) of the left ventricle
translation_value: An increased number and denisty of the trabeculae in the apex (tip) of the left ventricle

comment: definition of HP:0031203 (Fatty casts)  ; abnormality of metabolism/homeostasis ; abnormality of the genitourinary system
source_value: A type of acellular urinary casts that contain lipid droplets, oval fat bodies or cholesterol crystals, and are often associated with the free forms of these elements. Their identification may require the use of polarised light microscopy, under which fatty particles embedded into the cast matrix appear as Maltese crosses
translation_value: A type of acellular urinary casts that contain lipid droplets, oval fat bodies or cholesterol crystals, and are often associated with the free forms of these elements. Their identification may require the use of polarised light microscopy, under which fatty particles embedded into the cast matrix appear as Maltese crosses

comment: definition of HP:0031208 (Increased pituitary glycoprotein alpha subunit level)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: An increased concentration of circulating alpha polypeptide of glycoprotein hormones (Entrez Gene 1081). This alpha subunit is common to luteinizing hormone (LH) , follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) , thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) and human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), which are glycoprotein hormones composed of an identical alpha subunit together with a beta subunit that confers biological specificity. The alpha subunit is used as a marker for tumors that produce these hormones
translation_value: An increased concentration of circulating alpha polypeptide of glycoprotein hormones (Entrez Gene 1081). This alpha subunit is common to luteinizing hormone (LH) , follicle stimulating hormone (FSH) , thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) and human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), which are glycoprotein hormones composed of an identical alpha subunit together with a beta subunit that confers biological specificity. The alpha subunit is used as a marker for tumors that produce these hormones

source_value: Increased pituitary glycoprotein alpha subunit level
translation_value: Augmentation du niveau de la sous-unité alpha des hormones glycoprotéiques hypophysaires

source_value: Reduction in the activity of lipoprotein lipase in the blood

translation_value: Diminution de l'activité de la lipoprotéine lipase

translation_value: Diminution du taux de déhydroépiandrostérone dans la circulation

translation_value: Diminution du taux de sulfate de déhydroépiandrostérone dans la circulation.

comment: definition of HP:0031219 (Reduced radioactive iodine uptake)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: A decreased amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours afteradministration of the radioactive marker
translation_value: A decreased amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours afteradministration of the radioactive marker

comment: definition of HP:0031220 (Increased radioactive iodine uptake)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: An elevated amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours afteradministration of the radioactive marker
translation_value: An elevated amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours afteradministration of the radioactive marker

comment: definition of HP:0031221 (Abnormal radioactive iodine uptake test result)  ; abnormality of the endocrine system
source_value: Any deviation from normal in the amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours afteradministration of the radioactive marker
translation_value: Any deviation from normal in the amount of uptake on the radioactive iodine uptake (RAIU) test, which utilizes a radioisotope of iodine to measure how much iodine the thyroid gland absorbs from the blood. The radioactive marker is measured 4-6 hours and in some cases also 24 hours afteradministration of the radioactive marker

comment: definition of HP:0031237 (Internally nucleated skeletal muscle fibers)  ; abnormality of the musculature
source_value: An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally internal localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells)
translation_value: An abnormality in which the nuclei of sarcomeres take on an abnormally internal localization (or in which this feature is found in an increased proportion of muscle cells)

comment: definition of HP:0031260 (Triangular tibia)  ; abnormality of limbs ; abnormality of the skeletal system
source_value: A short, dysplastic tibia with a triangular shape. Instead of the normal shaft configuration of the tibia, the tibia forms a triangle with the longest side corresponding to the proximal-distal dimension, and the apex of the triangle diected laterally (See Figure 2 of PMID:18616733)
translation_value: A short, dysplastic tibia with a triangular shape. Instead of the normal shaft configuration of the tibia, the tibia forms a triangle with the longest side corresponding to the proximal-distal dimension, and the apex of the triangle diected laterally (See Figure 2 of PMID:18616733)

source_value: Keratoacanthoma (KA) is a common benign epithelial tumour that originates from the pilosebaceous glands. In most cases, it is characterized by rapid evolution, followed by spontaneous resolution over 4 to 6 months. KA usually presents as a solitary flesh-coloured nodule with a central keratin plug on the sun-exposed skin of elderly individuals
translation_value: Keratoacanthoma (KA) is a common benign epithelial tumour that originates from the pilosebaceous glands. In most cases, it is characterized by rapid evolution, followed by spontaneous resolution over 4 to 6 months. KA usually presents as a solitary flesh-coloured nodule with a central keratin plug on the sun-exposed skin of elderly individuals

comment: definition of HP:0031578 (Tessier number 6 facial cleft)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: A facial cleft extending from the zygomatic arch to the eye. This zygomaticomaxillary cleft is similar to that typically found in Treacher Collins syndrome. The overlying tissue shows a vertical sclerodermic furrow radiating from the labial commissure or the angle of the mandible across the cheek to a coloboma of the lower eyelid between the middle and lateral one-third. Microphthalmia is not observed. The skeletal cleft is between the maxilla and zygoma; it passes through the inferolateral orbital rim to enter the inferior orbital fissure. No alveolar cleft is present. The zygomatic arch is intact. The soft tissue furrow, which is more apparent on the right, radiates from the oral commissure toward the lateral two-thirds of the lower eyelid. The antimongoloid obliquity of the palpebral fissures is associated with laterally placed lower eyelid clefts and some ectropion. Aleft-sided anophthalmia is accompanied by adjacent soft tissue hypoplasia and is reflected in a short palpebral fissure, enophthalmos, and minor ptosis of the eyebrow. No abnormality is present in the alveolar arch except for some tilting of the occlusal plane secondary to hypoplasia of the left side of the maxilla. There is a vertical bony groove in the region of the zygomaticomaxillary suture that ends in the inferolateral portion of a small bony orbit. More laterally, the remainder of the zygomatic body and arch is normal in both shape and dimension. The lateral orbital floor is downslanting but intact, and it lacks direct communication with the temporal or infratemporal fossae. The hypoplasia of the left side of the maxilla and orbit is associated with a reduction in the transverse and anteroposterior dimensions of the anterior cranial fossa; mild asymmetry of the middle cranial fossa and calvarium is present. No significant asymmetry of size, shape, or position is present in the sphenoid
translation_value: A facial cleft extending from the zygomatic arch to the eye. This zygomaticomaxillary cleft is similar to that typically found in Treacher Collins syndrome. The overlying tissue shows a vertical sclerodermic furrow radiating from the labial commissure or the angle of the mandible across the cheek to a coloboma of the lower eyelid between the middle and lateral one-third. Microphthalmia is not observed. The skeletal cleft is between the maxilla and zygoma; it passes through the inferolateral orbital rim to enter the inferior orbital fissure. No alveolar cleft is present. The zygomatic arch is intact. The soft tissue furrow, which is more apparent on the right, radiates from the oral commissure toward the lateral two-thirds of the lower eyelid. The antimongoloid obliquity of the palpebral fissures is associated with laterally placed lower eyelid clefts and some ectropion. Aleft-sided anophthalmia is accompanied by adjacent soft tissue hypoplasia and is reflected in a short palpebral fissure, enophthalmos, and minor ptosis of the eyebrow. No abnormality is present in the alveolar arch except for some tilting of the occlusal plane secondary to hypoplasia of the left side of the maxilla. There is a vertical bony groove in the region of the zygomaticomaxillary suture that ends in the inferolateral portion of a small bony orbit. More laterally, the remainder of the zygomatic body and arch is normal in both shape and dimension. The lateral orbital floor is downslanting but intact, and it lacks direct communication with the temporal or infratemporal fossae. The hypoplasia of the left side of the maxilla and orbit is associated with a reduction in the transverse and anteroposterior dimensions of the anterior cranial fossa; mild asymmetry of the middle cranial fossa and calvarium is present. No significant asymmetry of size, shape, or position is present in the sphenoid

comment: definition of HP:0031584 (Tessier number 12 facial cleft)  ; abnormality of head or neck
source_value: There is a soft tissue cleft medial to the inner canthus with a cleft of the root of the eyebrow. The frontal process of the maxilla is flat and broadened, and the ethmoid labyrinth is increased in tranverse dimension, thereby producing orbital hypertelorism. The cribriform plate is of normal width. The frontal sinus is enlarged. Even though the frontal bone is flattened, bony clefts with encephalocele have not been observed. There is a lateral displacement of the inner canthus with a mild thinning, aplasia, or irregularity of the medial end of the eyebrow. There are no eyelid clefts. The soft tissue contour of the forehead is normal, with only a short downward prolongation of the paramedian frontal hairline to mark the superior extent of the soft tissue cleft. Flattening of the frontal process of the maxilla, an increase in the transverse dimension of the ethmoid sinus, and a laterally convex bowing of the medial orbital wall produce orbital hypertelorism. Superiorly there is a minor flattening of the frontal bone medially, and the nasofrontal angle is somewhat obtuse. The extensive pneumatization of the sinuses on the cleft side extends backward through the frontal and ethmoid sinuses and into the sphenoid sinus. The anatomy of the sphenoid, including the pterygoid processes, is otherwise normal. The anterior and middle cranial fossae floors are both broadened on the cleft side with minor widening of the cribriform plate
translation_value: There is a soft tissue cleft medial to the inner canthus with a cleft of the root of the eyebrow. The frontal process of the maxilla is flat and broadened, and the ethmoid labyrinth is increased in tranverse dimension, thereby producing orbital hypertelorism. The cribriform plate is of normal width. The frontal sinus is enlarged. Even though the frontal bone is flattened, bony clefts with encephalocele have not been observed. There is a lateral displacement of the inner canthus with a mild thinning, aplasia, or irregularity of the medial end of the eyebrow. There are no eyelid clefts. The soft tissue contour of the forehead is normal, with only a short downward prolongation of the paramedian frontal hairline to mark the superior extent of the soft tissue cleft. Flattening of the frontal process of the maxilla, an increase in the transverse dimension of the ethmoid sinus, and a laterally convex bowing of the medial orbital wall produce orbital hypertelorism. Superiorly there is a minor flattening of the frontal bone medially, and the nasofrontal angle is somewhat obtuse. The extensive pneumatization of the sinuses on the cleft side extends backward through the frontal and ethmoid sinuses and into the sphenoid sinus. The anatomy of the sphenoid, including the pterygoid processes, is otherwise normal. The anterior and middle cranial fossae floors are both broadened on the cleft side with minor widening of the cribriform plate

comment: definition of HP:0031588 (Unhappy demeanor)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: A conspicuously unhappy disposition characterized by negative assumptions, self-defeating talk, fear of failure, and negative ruminations about past events
translation_value: A conspicuously unhappy disposition characterized by negative assumptions, self-defeating talk, fear of failure, and negative ruminations about past events

source_value: Frequent thinking about or preoccupation with killing onself

comment: definition of HP:0031593 (Abnormal PR interval)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: An anomaly of the PR interval, which is the portion of the ECG from the end of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex. A normal PR interval in adults is from 0.12-0.2 seconds
translation_value: An anomaly of the PR interval, which is the portion of the ECG from the end of the P wave to the beginning of the QRS complex. A normal PR interval in adults is from 0.12-0.2 seconds

comment: definition of HP:0031597 (PR segment elevation)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: An increase in voltage of the PR segment below baseline
translation_value: An increase in voltage of the PR segment below baseline

comment: definition of HP:0031600 (P wave inversion)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: P wave below insteadof above the baseline. P-wave inversion in the inferior leads may indicate a non-sinus origin of the P waves
translation_value: P wave below insteadof above the baseline. P-wave inversion in the inferior leads may indicate a non-sinus origin of the P waves

comment: definition of HP:0031602 (Abnormal mucociliary clearance)  ; abnormality of the respiratory system

translation_value: An anomaly in the system of mucociliary transport, which functions to transport the mucous layer lining the respiratory epithelium by ciliary nbeating

comment: definition of HP:0031606 (Retinal cotton wool spot)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Fluffy white patch on the retina, representing localized areas of dense white swelling of the retinal nerve fibre layer. They often have a zigzag internal structure, a feathered edge but an otherwise well-delineated form and an approximately 1 mm dimension; they project slightly into the vitreous and sometimes deflect retinal vessels
translation_value: Fluffy white patch on the retina, representing localized areas of dense white swelling of the retinal nerve fibre layer. They often have a zigzag internal structure, a feathered edge but an otherwise well-delineated form and an approximately 1 mm dimension; they project slightly into the vitreous and sometimes deflect retinal vessels

translation_value: Origine anormale de l'artère sous-clavière droite à partir de l'aorte descendante

comment: definition of HP:0031643 (Fusiform ascending tubular aorta aneurysm)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the ascending tubular aorta that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall
translation_value: An eccentric abnormal localized widening (dilatation) of the ascending tubular aorta that involves only a portion of the circumference of the vessel wall

comment: definition of HP:0031663 (Paradoxical splitting of the second heart sound)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Normally, the aortic valve closure (A2) is followed by the pulmonic valve closure (P2) but the A2-P2 interval increases with inspiration and decreases with expiration. With paradoxical splitting, there is a delay in the closure of the aortic valve, so that A2 can follow P2; the individual components can be appreciated at the end of expiration and the interval narrows with inspiration (which is the oposite of the normal pattern)
translation_value: Normally, the aortic valve closure (A2) is followed by the pulmonic valve closure (P2) but the A2-P2 interval increases with inspiration and decreases with expiration. With paradoxical splitting, there is a delay in the closure of the aortic valve, so that A2 can follow P2; the individual components can be appreciated at the end of expiration and the interval narrows with inspiration (which is the oposite of the normal pattern)

comment: definition of HP:0031671 (Typical atrial flutter)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Typical atrial flutter is an organised atrial tachycardia. It can also be defined as a macroreentrant tachycardia confined to the right atrium. This arrhythmia has a 200-260 ms cycle length, although it may fluctuate depending on patient's previous treatment or ablation, congenital heart disease, etc. Ventricular rate response will be limited by the atrioventricular node conductions, usually presenting a 2:1 or 3:1 response, during atrial flutter. Typical (counter clockwise) flutter is associated with the common flutter pattern: a regular continuous undulation with dominant negative deflections in inferior leads II, III and aVF, often described also as a saw tooth pattern, and flat atrial deflections in leads I and aVL. Atrial deflections in V1 can be positive, biphasic or negative
translation_value: Typical atrial flutter is an organised atrial tachycardia. It can also be defined as a macroreentrant tachycardia confined to the right atrium. This arrhythmia has a 200-260 ms cycle length, although it may fluctuate depending on patient's previous treatment or ablation, congenital heart disease, etc. Ventricular rate response will be limited by the atrioventricular node conductions, usually presenting a 2:1 or 3:1 response, during atrial flutter. Typical (counter clockwise) flutter is associated with the common flutter pattern: a regular continuous undulation with dominant negative deflections in inferior leads II, III and aVF, often described also as a saw tooth pattern, and flat atrial deflections in leads I and aVL. Atrial deflections in V1 can be positive, biphasic or negative

comment: definition of HP:0031673 (Orthodromic atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A type of atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (AVRT) where the are the atrioventricular node is used for anterograde conduction and the accessory pathway for retrograde conduction
translation_value: A type of atrioventricular reentrant tachycardia (AVRT) where the are the atrioventricular node is used for anterograde conduction and the accessory pathway for retrograde conduction

comment: definition of HP:0031678 (Atherosclerotic lesion)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: A lesion associated with atherosclerosis, a multifactorial and multipart progressive disease manifested by the focal development within the arterial wall of lesions, that ranges from teh development of a fatty streak, plaque progression, and plaque disruption. Atherosclerotic lesions demonstrate consistent morphological characteristics, which indicate that each type may stabilize temporarily or permanently and that progression to the next type may require an additional stimulus
translation_value: A lesion associated with atherosclerosis, a multifactorial and multipart progressive disease manifested by the focal development within the arterial wall of lesions, that ranges from teh development of a fatty streak, plaque progression, and plaque disruption. Atherosclerotic lesions demonstrate consistent morphological characteristics, which indicate that each type may stabilize temporarily or permanently and that progression to the next type may require an additional stimulus

comment: definition of HP:0031714 (Distance exotropia)  ; abnormality of the eye

translation_value: A type of divergent strabismus (exotropia) in which an eye tends to turn outwards (i.e., the eye squints) mainly when looking at distant objects. The eyes tend to remain straight when they look at near objects. Distance exotropia may be constant or intermittant

comment: definition of HP:0031919 (Juvenile type ovarian granulosa cell tumor)  ; abnormality of the genitourinary system ; neoplasm
source_value: Juvenile granulosa cell ovarian tumor (JGCOT) is a rare sex cord stromal tumor, occuring most frequently in premenarchal girls or young women. In contrast to adult granulosa cell tumor, JGCOT has a high mitotic index and more aggressive tumor growth. Microscopically it is seen as diffuse and regularly distributed neoplastic cells with a wide cytoplasm and pleomorphic hyperchromatic nucleus. Follicle formation, in various sizes and shapes, is important in JGCOT. Call-Exner bodies are infrequently seen in JGCOT in contrast to the adult type
translation_value: Juvenile granulosa cell ovarian tumor (JGCOT) is a rare sex cord stromal tumor, occuring most frequently in premenarchal girls or young women. In contrast to adult granulosa cell tumor, JGCOT has a high mitotic index and more aggressive tumor growth. Microscopically it is seen as diffuse and regularly distributed neoplastic cells with a wide cytoplasm and pleomorphic hyperchromatic nucleus. Follicle formation, in various sizes and shapes, is important in JGCOT. Call-Exner bodies are infrequently seen in JGCOT in contrast to the adult type

comment: definition of HP:0031931 (Ocular flutter)  ; abnormality of the eye
source_value: Ocular flutter is an abnormal eye movement consisting of repetitive, irregular, involuntary bursts of horizontal saccades without an intersaccadic interval. It is generally superimposed on normal oculomotor behaviour and its occurrence may be favoured by various events, such as blinks, the triggering of normal saccades or optokinetic stimulation
translation_value: Ocular flutter is an abnormal eye movement consisting of repetitive, irregular, involuntary bursts of horizontal saccades without an intersaccadic interval. It is generally superimposed on normal oculomotor behaviour and its occurrence may be favoured by various events, such as blinks, the triggering of normal saccades or optokinetic stimulation

comment: definition of HP:0031932 (Aorto-left ventricular tunnel)  ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Aorto-left ventricular tunnel (ALVT) is a congenital extracardiac channel connecting the ascending aorta above the sino-tubular junction to either left ventricular cavity
translation_value: Aorto-left ventricular tunnel (ALVT) is a congenital extracardiac channel connecting the ascending aorta above the sino-tubular junction to either left ventricular cavity

comment: definition of HP:0031937 (Tachylalia)  ; abnormality of the nervous system

comment: definition of HP:0031938 (Abnormal conus terminalis morphology)  ; abnormality of the nervous system
source_value: Any structural anomaly of the conus terminalis, which is the distal bulbous part of the spinal cord at the location where the spinal cord tapers and ends (usaully between the L1 and L2 lumbar vertebrae)
translation_value: Any structural anomaly of the conus terminalis, which is the distal bulbous part of the spinal cord at the location where the spinal cord tapers and ends (usaully between the L1 and L2 lumbar vertebrae)

comment: definition of HP:0031941 (Abnormal portal venous system morphology)  ; abnormality of the digestive system ; abnormality of the cardiovascular system
source_value: Any structural anomaly of the portal venous sytem, which comprises all of the veins draining the abdominal part of the digestive tract, including the lower esophagus but excluding the lower anal canal. The portal vein conveys blood from viscera and ramifies like an artery at the liver, ending at the sinusoids. Tributaries of the portal vein, which make up the portal venous system, are the splenic, superior mesenteric, left gastric, right gastric, paraumbilical, and cystic veins
translation_value: Any structural anomaly of the portal venous sytem, which comprises all of the veins draining the abdominal part of the digestive tract, including the lower esophagus but excluding the lower anal canal. The portal vein conveys blood from viscera and ramifies like an artery at the liver, ending at the sinusoids. Tributaries of the portal vein, which make up the portal venous system, are the splenic, superior mesenteric, left gastric, right gastric, paraumbilical, and cystic veins

translation_value: A state of moror restlessness, usually in the lower extremities, that is often but not always accompanied by a subjective sense of inner restlessness, an urge to move, and anxiety or dysphoria
